1 finger off-white head.
Very dark brown coloured beer.
Aroma is coffee, brown sugar, vanilla, barrel and some dried dark fruits. Absolutely stunning for a Brown Ale. 
Taste is rich chocolate, nuts, vanilla and delicious fruity coffee. An obvious lactose sweetness joins in at the back.
Big, thick body on this one, on par with a single stout. Creamy and velvety smooth. Pretty heavy sweetness but never goes overboard. Low carbonation. Low bitterness, both coffee and hop-wise. Wouldve liked a bit more of that. 
Overall: Wow. Just wow. I had my doubts about this considering its a brown ale and I usually dont get along with light, dark ales but this absolutely knocks it out off the park. Shouldve known better than to doubt anything dark made by Founders. Fantastic beer.

Draught @ Waterfront Ale House. Clear dark brown with a reddish tint, small foamy beige head, sharp coffee beans aroma, medium carbonation, medium bitter roasted malt taste with coffee beans flavor, thick, smooth body, long smooth coffee finish. Very smooth and flavorful.

Bottle provided by Founders for review. The first pour, into a suitable goblet, is a deep dark coffee brown, with a foamy head this side of tan colored. The smell is almost saccharine, but thankfully not too strong, lending a big note of mocha java. Just a bit of roasty malt behind it.
The taste loses the sweet from the nose, trading in for a warm, alcoholic strong beer taste. There is definitely a blonde roast coffee taste, which goes to one part of my head while the alcohol goes to another. Part of that might be due to the hot weather Ive been not enjoying. I detect very little hop bitterness, unless thats what Im sensing at the malt roast. Either way, theres clearly something keeping the sweetness and alcohol from swarming my senses. However, there is a slightly sugary cola flourish at the end.
Another strong, dark beer from Founders that works best as dessert. It would be worth getting a couple of bottles for cellaring and tasting at intervals.

Kolor czarny, piwo nieprzejrzyste z bardzo ładną pianą. Aromat jest świetny - kawa niesamowicie intensywna, bardzo szlachetna. Oprócz tego czuć też gorzką czekoladę, kakao, ciastka, troszkę karmelu. W smaku bardzo pełne, słodkie oraz przede wszystkim kawowe. Ta kawa przesłania nieco pozostałe cechy piwa. Czuć również nieco wanilii oraz czekolady. Goryczka na średnim poziomie, wysycenie niskie.
Dark coffee brown. Coffee aroma. Coffee flavor. Coffee aftertaste. Somewhere the brown ale disappeared. Damn covfefe!

This stuff isnt bad. It has a solid coffee flavor thats not overwhelming and doesnt have a bunch of vegetable weirdness like a lot of similar brews. This is rather on the heavy side and just a bit hot but not too sweet so relatively drinkable for its gravity. There is a nice nutty malt character underpinning which keeps it from just being a coffee bomb. I think most people who are inclined to enjoy this sort of beer are going to like this.
On tap at Rattle n Hum. Pours a very dark brown. Hints of coffee and beans on the nose. Full bodied, with a creamy finish. Malt and coffee. Very nice.

12 oz. bottle from Total Wine, Chesapeake, VA (bottled March 31, 2017). Dark brown pour with a creamy off-white head. Aroma of rich roasted coffee and faint peanuts. The taste is unmistakably a brown ale but the added coffee gives it a necessary punch to make this beer anything but boring like most brown ales. Great beer!

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2017 Dark brown, mahogny-colored beer with a creamy, beige head that sinks down to a thin layer and leaves small lacing on the glass. 

Nose: Roasted malt, coffee/espresso, toffee, caramel, fudge, marzipan, chocolate, nuts and bitter hops. 
Taste: Coffee, coffee beans, dry roasted malt, red berries, dark chocolate, cocoa and sweet caramel. Warming alcohol at the end together with a nice bitterness at the tongue. 

Full body with high carbonation. 
A true masterpiece!

Smell of toasted malt and coffee. Deep dark brown color with medium cream crown. Taste of balanced malt, coffee, right bitterness. Lasting with tannin on your tongue. Slightly over medium body. Good beer.

On nitro at Whole Foods at Fairfax Corner in Fairfax, VA. 

Opaque, brown-black with a fine, creamy, cream-colored head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of rich roasted coffee, roasted malt and hints of chocolate. 

Taste of lightly roasted coffee, roasted malt, a touch of smokiness and lots of sweet lactose in a perfect balance. 

Full body and low carbonation with a wonderful rich, creamy mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fullpackad av kaffe. Smakar även del av toffee och en uns av rök. Rätt trevlig.
-late tap from untappd, bottle share in Skien- Freshly crushed coffee bean. Sweet and fruity finish. Great! Loads of coffee.

Dark brown/black color; Medium to heavy slightly creamy body; Aroma of smoky toasted malt, rich coffee beans, & some dark chocolate; Flavor of roasted/burnt malt, rich coffee/espresso, hops, dark chocolate, and caramel; Finish is fairly bitter; Nicely balanced; Very much like their breakfast stout - awesome!
Tried it a the Founders Brewery, pours a dark brown with a strong smell and taste of coffee. Great beer.

12floz bottle ($11/four-pack, BOD: 04.13.2017) poured into a pint glass. Coffee and to a lesser extent cocoa evident in the nose - pretty good, but Ive experienced better aromatic beers with such traits. Dark-brown in color with clarity when held to the light, and the head sustains. This is exactly as meant to be, a full bodied brown ale with the addition of coffee. Caramel toastedness is apparent to complete a palate that has mild bitterness. Quite good, the alcohol is present, yet masked.

Pours a semi opaque dark brown with a creamy light tan head. Medium carbonation with lots of lacing. Aroma of rich roasted coffee. Creamy smooth body with a silky smooth full mouth feel. Coffee flavor is prominent but not harsh or bitter. Nice smooth finish with a long lingering aftertaste. Even better than I expected. Hide the alcohol well. Very enjoyable.

Rich coffee aroma, deep brown color with a small lacing that fades when poured. Bold coffee and malt presence when tasted, but executed perfectly. After taste is slightly sweet and bitter. Well done Imperial Brown Ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From tap. Dark reddish-brown with a thin beige head. Nose is all fresh brewed coffe. Flavors are coffee, malt, with some char and slight vegetal character, just a touch of sweetness. Long finish, slight bitterness. Hides the alcohol well.
12oz bottle made on 4/5/17 - nose is coffee roast. Sip adds more coffee and booze. Lactose finish. A sipper.

Dark blood red color. Clear appearance with minimal head and collapses into a pencil-thin collar. Aroma is coffee, malt, chocolate, and smoke. Body is alot creamier than expected. Starts off with a pronounce coffee taste with bittersweet chocolate that follows the coffee up. The finish is long and hits you with some hoppiness. This beer is well balanced. I was pleasantly suprised!!

On tap at Sir Ben's. Deep coffee brown in color. Scent malts, caramel, cocoa, and complex coffee. Taste is largely the coffee which is very rich. There's a tiny bit of hoppy bitterness which balances the maltier notes. A bit of chocolate. All in all a very enjoyable beer.

Bottle.

A: Mahogany body that gets real close too black, cappuccino head, light lacing.

N: Crunchy coffee, earth, toffee, peppercorn, some marshmallow, ash, roast, toasted biscuit, and slices of bakers chocolate.

T: Sweet, bitter, and roasty.

M: Medium body, spritzy carbonation, no alcohol.

O: A pleasing beer. The coffee complements the Imperial Brown really well.

Draft... Pours clear and black with crimson sparkles a small, creamy, beige collar. The nose features deeply roasted coffee. Full-bodied with airy carbonation. Nice mocha flavor. Moderately sweet, but moreso roasty and a hint carbonic. Bittersweet, charcoal, dark chocolate finish.
Nice coffee brew. Good head, nice color. Nice coffee nose and flavor. Easy drinkin, well rounded. Bottle from statelineliquors.

Pours brown with a thin cap of mocha foam. Aroma is dominated by very good smelling coffee with hints of sweet malt to complement. Flavor is similar but even better with the coffee being accompanied by nice roasted flavors and a well-balanced sweetness that keeps this brew on the slightly sweet side - my preference. Finish has a slight bitter note, much like coffee itself, but smooth and drinkable for certain. Great after-dinner beer.

On tap at Salty Duck. Though its classified as a strong ale, its my favorite brown ale. I have to say my favorite beers are all coffee forward and this one does not disappoint. Carbonation is just right with a great feel as you drink it. While the aroma lets you know its at 9% you dont notice while drinking. Very drinkable. I never have just one
.

Bottle from Beers of the World in Rochester, NY. Pours a dark reddish-brown with a foamy, tan head that lingers long and leaves generous lacing. Nose is somewhat boozy, malty coffee with a hint of dark chocolate. Taste is bitter with a long, dry, corresponding finish. Medium body. Lively carbonation. Nice brew as usual from one of Michigans finest!

Pours deep chestnut brown with a medium, staying, thick creamy beige head. Aroma has toasted caramel behind heavy fresh coffee (beans), a bit of chocolate. Low, prickly carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has sweet malts, caramel, toasted, nuts, mild chocolate, quite a bit of nice balancing coffee dryness. Works well with the warming viniousness and relatively high bitterness.

Roasted and nutty. Mouthfeel is carbonated and contains good head. Nice, amber color 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown color nose of coffee and sweet malt. Taste follows with a bitter coffee flavor but a brown ale finish. Very nice take and alcohol is well hidden.

Another masterpiece from the great one! Pours dark brown w/ some red hues that has a lasting tan head & good lacing. The aroma is a phenomenal mix of chocolate & coffee that is quite powerful. The taste is a harmonious blend between the chocolate & coffee. It leaves a hint of sweetness & a bit of bitterness lingering. The body is slightly thin for such a deep & high abv brew but this is nevertheless wonderful!

Pours a deeper brown with a medium, creamy looking, tan head. Plenty of coffee in the aroma, and very earthy as as well. Heavy caramel, some chocolate, and some roasted malts complete the nose. This one is bitter and mildly sweet. I get an immediate presence of alcohol that coffee and licorice attempt to cover. There are strong impressions of roasted malts and caramel as well, with undertones of nuts, cocoa, chocolate, and a very slight spicy burn. Good lingering aftertaste of chocolate and coffee. More full in body, with a thicker texture, and average in carbonation. This is tasty and solid, and Id easily go to this again.

Draft at Midland Beer Garden. Dark brown with a thick light beige head. Dark roasted coffee aroma. Smooth and malty. Excellent brown ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep brown pour with a one finger light beige head that has great retention. Roast, dark caramel, earthy coffee and some nice nutty notes in the nose. Flavor is dark caramel, bran muffin, earthy coffee, light fruity honey notes, nutty notes. Medium body, creamy to chewy feel on entry, light, blanketing carbonation, off dry finish. Really tasty stuff.

12 oz bottle. Nice strong coffee flavor with peppercorns and vegetal notes. Deep roasted malts that really complement the coffee. The brown was a good choice in the base beer that gives it just enough chocolate flavors. Love it!
Dark brown pour with a thick beige head. Aroma is mostly coffee with some chocolate and caramel. Coffee backs of a bit on the tongue. Nicely bittersweet. Damn good.

12 ounce bottle. Translucent cola brown color. Moderate frothy tan head. Intense roasted malt nose is flush with Sumatran dark roast coffee. Bold roasted malt flavor is redolent of coffee and cocoa beans. Smooth and creamy with slightly roasty, earthy, nutty malt goodness. A subtle alcohol kiss finishes this ale nicely.

Dark brown pour with khaki head. Smells is coffee-aggressive, but accompanied with spicy wood smoke and leather. Taste follows the nose, with a strong malt component halfway through. The coffee presents first, but a perfect marriage between the coffee and malt character meet at the end and extend into the aftertaste. Mouthfeel is medium/thick with moderate carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice beer. Great coffee aroma and flavor. Very good beer for the money. Good to have a beer from Founders thats not so hard to get in MN.
Bottle, Deep rich brown with a tight dense tan head. Lots of coffee and sot chocolate light roast in the aroma. Rich smooth chocolate and coffee flavors. Slick heavy palate. Very good.

Pours a very dark brown in the glass. Almost impossible to see any light when held up to a light source. Strong coffee aroma. Pretty much nothing else but coffee... not that Im complaining. Very assertive coffee and mocha flavor notes. Its almost like Im drinking espresso. Overall, a very tasty brew. Thanks to the always GENEROUS BarZigKin for the awesome hook up!
An aroma of coffee, malt, and caramel, pours a hazy dark brown color with a thin, brown head. A taste of coffee, dark chocolate and licorice. A lighter medium body with a lasting mocha coffee finish.

Rated on 5-06-2017 at New Paradigm B.C. The appearance of this draft beer is a small head that fully diminished, opaque reddish brown body and no lacing. The aroma is coffee, dark malt, roasted, and caramel. The flavor is light-medium bitter, coffee, chocolate, roasted, and dark malt. The mouthfeel is light carbonation and this beer is medium bodied. I do not really care all that much for the taste of this beer due to coffee since I am not a coffee drinker. If one is a coffee drinker then it is worth trying.

The aroma is coffee, some licorice. Pours a dark brown with big tan head, mostly lasting and excellent lacing. The taste is bitter. The body is medium, the texture creamy, the carbonation lively and the finish bitter. Very Good!!
From a bottle. Super smooth coffee flavour with a sweet milky finish, delicous stuff.

Bottle from Whole Foods Market Fair Lakes
Aroma: coffee, chocolate, roasty
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 
Very tasty

Pours a dark brown with some nice ruby shining through when held up to light. There is a two finger tan head that left some nice lacing around the glass.The aroma is is very sweet dark chocolate, coffee, brown sugar, and toasted barley malts. The flavor is very similar to the aroma. There is so much sweetness from the chocolate and caramel and brown sugar with some nice bitterness from all the coffee. This is a very well balanced beer and the abv is very well hidden. The mouthfeel is medium and drinkability is quite high so you have to be careful with the 9% abv.

Pours a rich brown with a beige head. Aroma is java and nuttiness, some caramel....all there but a bit muted. Tastes like freshly roasted coffee beans but also a refreshing earthy edge, tea and molasses. Well masked alcohol. A bit thin. Not bad.

This draft brew from a beer bar was served at a cool temperature and poured a small sized head of frothy fine to medium sized light brown colored bubbles that were quickly diminishing and left behind no visible carbonation opaque dark cola brown colored body and a poor lacing. The weak aroma was brown malt. with a lingering malty aftertaste. The nice flavor contained notes of molasses brown malt and dark malt. A decent one that I would consider buying again.

A solid but understated imperial Brown. A mild and slightly sweet malt nose. The taste includes elements of citrus and earthy hops, softly roasted malt, mild coffee, cream and a slightly vegetal aftertaste. Well balanced, but I could use a little more oomph.

Tough categorie. Pours a beautiful deep reddish brown. The nose projects a rich coffee smell, not just any coffee, but one that is rich with a special aroma. A smooth velvety palate. Strong flavors of nuts with coffee mixed with a malty brew. Very good. Alcohol is hidden. I will drink more of this.

Nose is deep sweet malts and quality roasted coffee. Anytime the flavor tries to get to sweet the roast in the coffee and slight hop bitterness keeps it in check. Reminded me a lot of a couple of the Terrapin coffee stouts, just with a bigger body and maaaaaybe a touch sweeter. Awesome beer.

Oh my, what a coffee beer. Giant java nose, roasty and deep, and the pours a nice dark brown with a slight beige head but ample lace. Initially sweet, with a thick brown ale maltiness giving up massive caramel and chocolate, yet the coffee brings up the rear, deep and black, balancing out the sweeter notes. Finishes with a piney bitterness, strong and resinous, accenting the espresso undertone. Silky smooth feel. Delicious.

More of a malty alcohol aroma with only subtle coffee. Nice large white suds. Heavy on the palate. Slight carbonation and alcohol hidden. But dark and burnt (in a good way). 

- Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft pours brown with a tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee and some caramel. Taste is nutty, coffee and chocolate.

24.04.2017, 12 oz bottle @ home:
Nice light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich, dark malts, espresso, lactose, caramel, chocolate pudding, minerals, toast, hay, roasted grain. Taste is slightly dry sour-ish roasted, dark malts, cocoa, espresso, minerals, toast, roasted grain, chocolate pudding, hay, lactose, grass. Medium bitterness, slightly dry roasted mouthfeel. Nice.

Wow, really good. Nice white tight head with a beautiful brown pour with hints of bright Amber. The flavor is coffee coffee coffee with a nice bit of malt and a hint of nut. Its really fun. It doesnt have the creamy mouthfeel of a stout, but in many ways resembles a coffee beverage more for this. Very good.

Pours a chestnut / mahogany color with almost no head. Nose is coffee with malt undertones. Taste is not like a brown ale but more like a stout. Taste is coffee, some sweetness, and some residual bitterness. Can taste the alcohol a bit. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
very strong coffee aroma. dark red in color with decent head. full body, good mouthfeel. taste is strongly of coffee, lesser flavors of chocolate and roasted barley.

*Bottled 5/6/16* Coffee has fallen off quite a bit, that being said the base beer is so good it hardly matters. Its a great example of a brown with a now a muddled hint of the coffee. Caramel malt & chocolate blend seamlessly with the fading coffee notes.
Coffee (I assume) floaties can be seen when poured. Still roasty, still a great mouthfeel.

BOTTLED ON 03/31/17. Nose dark Arabica and roast, light wood, nuts, brown malts. Pour light brown with a large and foamy beige head, slightly oily and patchy lace. Flavor loaded with coffee, brown roast, slightly dry but with slightly sweet plum and red berry that seems to have been infused into the smooth alcohol, bringing heft with swirling malt and coffee thickness; medium bitterness at times but smooth, only lightly airy and minerally, great richness of tone throughout, only medium-full body but a great choice for something this strength. This one really wins points for balance, seems like a dozen oars all pulling in the same direction, a lovely one through and through. [2017.04.15: 4.0]

Pours black with a red hue. Aroma of rich coffee, raisins and dates. Taste is beautifully sweet then offset by a delicious bitterness from the coffee beans. Truly delicious beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Olutravintola Konttori, Verkatehtaankatu 5, Tampere, Finland 33100. [ As Founders Sumatra Mountain Brown ].Clear dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to light beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, dark malt, roasted, sweet malt, dusty coffees. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, sugary coffee, sweet malt, coffee bitter, dark malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20160707]
 7-4-8-3-15

Dark brown with a light beige head, good retention and nice lacework. Aroma has strong coffee notes with some burnt sugar hints. Flavor is light bittery, coffee notes are mostly present with some wooden notes. Slightly bitterness on palate, toasty and coffee final.

Bottle. It pours black with a dense beige head. The aroma is malty with fresh grinded coffee notes. Some biscuit notes. Thick mouthfeel. Roasted flavor with coffee and tobacco notes. Great malty notes.

4/29/16. Bottle from somewhere local. Brown pour with a nice tan head. Nice aroma, good coffee balance (and not green pepper) with chocolate and nuttiness. Good flavor, not too sweet, good coffee balance, chocolate, nuts, caramel. Tasty!
UPDATED: JUN 20, 2017 bottle. heavy taste with nut, coffee and roasted malt. good in winter but not easy to drink.

From cask with a pitch black body and thick, creamy brown head. Aromas of coffee beans reign on the nose. Smooth, sweet flavor with roasted coffee beans and espresso. Soft creamy carbonation and surprisingly light and easy to drink. Very nice, balanced and almost quenchable IS.

Bottle from 啤酒阿姨 in Shanghai. Pours a very dark brown, opaque but not at all thick, creamy beige head. Smells fantastic: roasted coffee, barley and oatmeal, light nutty caramel, background inky slightly herbal bitterness, faint cherry liqueur and wood. Taste is similar, though more thin - has a roasted acidity that doesnt veer over into being too sharp, no thickness/creaminess but enough coffee and bitterness for balance. Body is thin to medium, slight acidic burnt malt edge, frothy chewier finish. 9% ABV almost alarmingly well hidden: Excellent, warm, well balanced.

Bottle from 啤酒阿姨 in Shanghai at home in HK. Dark dark cola brown pour with sticky dense light tan head. Aroma is rich coffee chocolate and caramel - delicious. Like a sweet beer-y moccachino. Smell is almost like an imperial stout, as is taste at first. Before giving way to a more nutty taste and light bodied (vs imperial stout) palate. Fresh coffee and dark chocolate. Definitely one of the best brown ales Ive had. Rich and smooth carbonation. Lasting warm nutty bitterness. Great.
355ml bottle at House of Belgium, Xiamen. Pours dark brown with an off white head. Aroma of malt and chocolate with coffee. Very smooth mouthfeel. Sweet finish with a hint of bitterness.

12 oz. bottle, pours a deep dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma brings out rich espresso notes upfront, followed by dark chocolate and a little caramel malt sweetness. Flavour is very rich, with a great blend of espresso, chocolate and caramel, finishing on the coffee notes, with medium sweetness. Wonderfully constructed, rich but not cloying or abrasive, and delicious overall.

Pour out of 12 oz bottle, thick brownish black pour with tan head, aroma brought notes of coffee, cocoa, roast, hints of dark fruit into more cold press coffee, slight grassy hops. Taste was a mix of cocoa, roast, vanilla into coffee, espresso with some dark fruits, finishing sweet, slightly roasted.

Cola looking beer with medium, but quickly vanishing head. Strong aroma is nice with dark chocolate and coffee. Taste has coffee, dark chocolate, sweet roast. A bit more than medium body, soft and oily. Nice.

Pours dark brown with a thick, creamy head. The palate is thick, creamy, smooth. Thats the best part. Aroma is coffee grounds with little if anything else getting through. Taste is lightly milk chocolate sweet at the outset, but soon flooded with a stale coffee bitterness. Finishes with more coffee and a light, lingering bitterness. Overall feel  this is less a beer than a coffee drink. Where is the brown ale? The caramel? The nutty undertones? Too one dimensional.

Tap at Bishops Arms. Clear dark brown with a small light brown head. Aroma medium+ malty (caramel, roasted, coffee, notes of chocolate). Flavor medium sweet, coffee, dark chocolate, well balanced. Medium+ body, smooth. Nice.
Pours dark brown with little head. Aroma has lots of coffee with a touch of chocolate. Big coffee! The taste is much the same. Short review but this is one great beer.
Pours brown with a lingering one-finger tan head with an aroma of malt, coffee & wood. Tastes of deep rich coffe, malt & cocoa powder with a mild hop finish. Very smooth, rich & well balanced.

Poured from a bottle into a tulip: Pours clear dark brown with almost no head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts, leaves, earth. Taste is mildly sweet, lots of burned roasted coffee and malt, light caramel. Very smooth, medium body, tons of coffee, very tasty.

12oz bottle pours with a clear dark brown body that has thin gold edges and supports a tan head. The aroma offers up a snippet of chili pepper coffee oils, that nearly faded away after a few minutes, as well as rich smelling earthy modestly roasted coffee and then a light sense of malts and caramel malts at the end of the draw. The taste delivers the expected rich smooth earthy coffee goodness that builds into a modest layer of dark roasted to faintly burnt coffee. At midway the mild malts show and toward the finish it gets into a light sweet nuttiness. This is a fine rich coffee brown.
Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is coffee and treacle, as is the flavour. This is a tremendous beer.
Bottle from systembolaget Sweden. Big and lasting brown head. Clear red dark brown color. Big and totally dominate coffee aroma. The coffee also dominate the taste and it lacks beer taste.
Bottle. Dark brown with small tan head. Aroma of caramel and some coffee. Taste is caramel, chocalate and coffee. Smooth and perfectly balanced.
Bottle. Pours deep brown with aromas of coffee, autumn leaf litter, a touch of chocolate. Flavor is the same. Kind of thin and coffee dominant and very unidirectional.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle. Nice brown colour, clear with creamy head. Aroma of good quality coffee, caramel, chocolate. In taste likewise, really nice sweetness, toasted and caramel notes with coffee aftertaste. Very tasty.

Bottle at the Sheepshank, Bangkok. Poured a clear dark brown with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is roasty liqouice malt, big coffee, some chocolate. The flavour is liqouice bitter with a smooth dry coffee liqouice alcoholic bitter palate and frothy mouthfeel with a long bitter finish. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle sampled via Jmgreenuk at Sheepshank, Bangkok. 
Coffee aroma. Thin ring tan head clear black pour. Lots of roasted coffee in the aftertaste. Nice.
Mørk brun farge med beige skum. Lukter kaffe, mørk sjokolade og karamellmalt. Smaker Sjokolade og mokka, Bittersøt avslutning. God!

Bottle. Pours deep brown with with a modest khaki head. Aroma is coffee and cocoa. Taste is coffee, vanilla, oak, molasses sweet, cocoa bitter.

Bottle - aroma is chocolate and coffee. Pours with a smooth pale white head similar to Guiness, but not quite so creamy or long lasting. Taste follows the smell and sweet dark chocolates fight with bitter coffee to get the attention of your taste buds. Neither wins through and you are left wondering if it is sweet or bitter. Intereting and drinkable, but I could't drink lots of it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from unknown place. Pours jet black with an inch of thick khaki foam. Leaves a shitload of lacing in the glass. Massive coffee on the nose which is very nice. Lovely nutty brown ale which combines well with the coffee. Hides its booze well. Quite a lovely beer.

Pours a jet black color and has no real head retention or lacing. It smells like burnt coffee and dark chocolate. Has a boozy taste up front but mellows nicely for a smooth finish. Also has a nutty, rich flavor which adds to it. Nice drink!

Bottle. Sensoric. Deep brown with small, light brown, semi-thick head. Poor head retention and lacing. Moderately to heavy malty aroma - mainly roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, caramel, bread, brown sugar, toffee, some light dark fruits. Beside this lots of freshly brewed coffee (espresso like). Taste is moderately sweet and moderately to heavy bitter, esp. in the end of degustation, long and stable. Medium body, watery to oily texture, average carbonation, finish is dry, bitter, coffee. ABV level is below warming. Moderately drinkable. Summary: Really nice stuff. Nice coffee flavor, nice toasted notes. Podsumowanie: Kolejny raz nie jestem zawiedziony. Nuty palone, opiekane, karmelowe, toffi, dużo kawy, lekkie nuty owocowe, czekolada. Wszystko wyciśnięte do granic możliwości. Mogłoby być trochę pełniejsze.
Bottle. Dark brown body with tan foam. Very nice fruity, spocy, herbal coffee, nutty aromas. Medium bodied. Fruity herbal coffee, nutty roasty flavors with some alcohol heat to finish___good.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Bottle. Dark brown pour. Aroma of soft mocha, coffee, caramel and malt. Taste of bitter coffee, roasted malt, creamy mocha, caramel, toffee and gritty coffee finish. Very nice.
Pours dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malty and slight bread with plenty of coffee, herbal, chocolate and dark malty. Flavour is medium sweet. Excellent.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Coffee, lots and lots of coffee, some chocolate and caramel that manages to get through the huge amount of coffee.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Coffee, alcohol, more coffee, some caramel, even more coffee.
Comment: Way too unbalanced. Would be nice to get something besides coffee.

Backlog from GABF 2016
Dark brown appearance with a tan head. Aroma of caramel/toffee, chocolate malt, coffee and light noble hops. Similar flavor, rich and robust, leading to a bittersweet finish. Medium to full body. Pretty good overall.

Tap @ Bakgården Både &. Dark brown body, almost black with a dense, lacing beige head. Aromais toally dominating by coffee, quality coffee. Flavor has sweet, dark malt, fruity, chocolate, good bitterness and of course lots of good coffee. Full bodied and long lasting aftertaste with dark malt and coffee. A well bade coffee flavored beer this.

Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma has toasted malt, a bit of caramel and green coffee notes. Taste starts with the green coffee / pepper flavor, continues with chocolate and finishes with roasted coffee bitterness. Full body with smooth mouthfeel. A really nice coffee ale, smooth and tasty.
On tap at Brewdog bar Helsinki. Reddish brown with beige head. Aroma has bitter chocolate, nice fresh coffee notes, roasted malts and malt sugar. Taste is similar, very pleasant coffee notes.

Thanks to Chris for this awesome brew! Bien sombre, pas noire mais presque, dun brun profond et riche. Tête bien mousseuse, généreuse et alléchante qui tient parfaitement sur mon verre. Un fort pressentiment dune bière intense et savamment élaborée. Ces malts parfaitement balancés, ce café de qualité torréfié à la perfection. Jamais lun ne prend le dessus sur lautre. Un houblon contribue également à léquilibre. Amertume plaisante en finale alors que le liquide se dérobe avec légèreté et élégance. Je ne mattendais pas à une bière de ce niveau en ce lundi soir.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2016 Btl pours a clear dark brown color,with a big dense off white head that lingers for a long time. Bits of lace are left on glass. Aromas of chocolate,coffee,
earth,and sweet malt. Tastes of coffee,vanilla,chocolate,alcohol,sweet caramel, and some earthiness. Silky smooth mouthfeel,vibrant carbonation,heavy body and a bittersweet slightly boozey finish. The coffee definitely takes this perfectly balanced brown ale to heavenly level. If you like coffee,this bold brew is highly recommended!

Bottle from Discount Liquor. Pours a deep brown to black with a finger of foam that lingers. Nose is all roasted coffee, cacao nib and toasted caramel. Coffee bomb with cacao, almond and a touch of cola on the palate. Quaffable for 9% abv. Endless coffee. Bitter, roasty finish, but still well-balanced with the malt. Lingering chocolate and coffee. Absurdly good.
Bottle. Black, minimal head, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, & long finish.

12oz via trade - Very nice color, mahogany brown with reddish edges. 3 finger coffee espresso head. big and small bubbles. It smells really nice. Loads of cold brew coffee and syrup. decent mouthfeel, thin, light with a very roasty finish and sugary sweet up front. Not bad at all.
Bottle shared with Andy and Folty 11/4/16. Dark brown pour. Aroma of coffee, but not overpowering, and chocolate with a hint of spice. Taste is sweet and slightly spicy. Smooth and easy drinking.

Dark brown body with light tan head. Lovely coffee aroma - which follows through in the taste - full body and the depth of the body is all of the coffee to me, I like my coffee though I like it with the bitterness more pronounced, Founders make some great beers!!!!!!!

355 ml bottle from Hawthorne Cellars. Pours dark brown with medium light tan head that fades over a few minutes. Aroma is strong coffee. Flavour has coffee with some subtle undertones of carmel and chocolate. If you like coffee this beer will be a winner for you. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 ounce bottle, 6/1/16. Dark reddish brown, large foamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of strong coffee, roasted malts. The taste is caramel, coffee, vanilla, mild roast. Medium bodied.
Очень вкусное пиво, шикарны& натурал& кофейны& аромат, отличны& мощный вкус и послевк& с мягкой горечью. Срок годност& до 05.02.2017. (Bottle 0,355/ 9,0%)
Flaska. Mörkbrun med ett smutsvitt skum. Dofter av kaffe, mörk choklad och trä. Smakinslag av kaffe, choklad, vanilj och karamell. Bitter avslutning. Semitorr munkänsla.
This quite different brew reminds me of saying: If it doesnt challenge you, it doesnt change you. Fred Devito

Pours a four finger brown head that fades slowly leaving a good lace. Black color, no highlights. Medium carbonation and medium bodied. Coffee nose, flavor is roasted coffee some chocolate and malts. $3.54 for a 12oz bottle from Beverage Warehouse Winooski, VT.

Bottle from mikkeller webshop. Color is red, copper to brown. Head is medium and beige. Super smooth body. Medium carbonation. Medium bitterness. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, cacao, malt, pepper, wood, malt. This is very easy-drinkable for 9%!
Tap at Brewdog Helsinki, Helsinki. Colour is clear dark brown with small slightly brownish head. Aromas and flavors: Coffee, chocolate, dark chocolate, dryness and malts. Very soft.
Bottle. Dark brown beer with a brown head. Coffee and rich malt aroma. Caramel/toffee flavor with roast and coffee. Medium-plus bodied. Caramel/toffee lingers with coffee and light fruitiness.

Bottle at Hair of the dog, Bangkok. Cloudy brown with a ring tan head. Aroma of massive fresh coffee, cold roast, dark chocolate, malt and toffee. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown color with a small off-white head. Has a slightly roasted malty coffee and caramel aroma. Slightly roasted malty coffee and caramel flavor. Has a slightly roasted malty coffee finish.

Pullo. Tummanruskea. Tuoksussa tuhkaa, pähkinää, suklaata, hedelmää, kahvia ja voita. Maku jatkaa samaa linjaa. Suodatinkahvi, keitetyt vihannekset, hedelmää ja paahdetut maltaat. Miedosti humaloitu. Medium runko ja happo. Ei kyllä toimi. Epämiellyttävä kokonaisuus.

Front bottle. Pours a dark, clear, reddish brown with a short lasting, beige head. Aroma has toffee, roasted malts, coffee, raisins, sweet licorice. Taste is sweet, lots of toasted malts, light burnt raisins, bitter notes, quite a lot of fruitiness. Pretty full bodied and with an average carbonation.
Dark brown body brown head nice lacing. Strong aroma of coffee, oats, woodsy notes. Taste is fairly rich, dry cocoa and coffee, with hint so dried fruit and a dry hint of bitter finish. Nice beer.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a decent, beige head. Aroma is coffee, caramel, slight nuttiness, cold, thin coffee thats been standing long. Not the most pleasant aroma. Taste is coffee, coffee beans, slight chocolate, slight roast. Nuttiness. Not too pleasant. Not sure where all the alcohol is as it doesnt feel at all strong.

Bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Pours murky dark brown with a medium-sized brownish head. The aroma is intriguing: it offers substantial roasty maltiness with especially mocca rising forward, with some vanilla and licorice  imperial stoutish in style but other features appear as well. Taste is pretty much in par with what the aroma promised: flavours include mocca-style coffee, chocolate, nutty maltiness, and dark fruitiness, plum in particular. Overall this is light sweet initially, later becoming very roasty and in the finish faintly bitter  malt-driven all in all, only mild hoppiness appears. The palate is medium to full bodied, low to medium in carbonation. Interesting, as American strong ales usually are.
On draft at the Pump House. Served in a snifter. Very dark brown and inviting. Rich coffee and chocolate abounds. Interesting bitterness and spice. I never noticed the alcohol. Very good.

Bottle 35,5 cl. Pours a reddish brown with a slight haze and a beige head. Very intense espresso aroma. Rich, malty body, very smooth on the palate, creamy almost, sweet caramel malts but coffee and subtle hops makes this not go all too cloying. But intensely coffeeish. 041016
A fantastic beer. Great aromas of fresh brewed coffee, nuts, toasted malts, lactose. Flavours of coffee, cream, malts. Very well balanced. Coffee doesnt over power. Beautiful.

Aroma - very rich roasted coffee, some chocolate, caramel, and alcohol.
Appearance - body is a bistre brown. The head is beige and about 3/4" settles very slowly. here is good lacing all the way throughout.
Taste - has a rich coffee flavor, dark roast, rich chocolate, and some alcohol.
Palate - medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, slightly bitter finish that fades quickly.

Draft. A dark brown beer with a lazing brown head. The aroma has notes of malt, caramel, coffee, and bread. The flavor is sweet with notes of coffee, caramel, bread, bisquits, and bread, leading to a dry finish.

12 oz bottle purchased from City Beer. Opening it in celebration of Frankoes closong soon. So many good times. Thick, syrupy brown pour with a thin tan head. This is a brown ale that all brown ales should look up to. It has a strong coffee impression that is nothing short of incredible, but a solid base beer to back that up. Bold dark chocolate, coffee bean, and maple syrup like aroma. Its really sweet, bit it couldnt work any better than it does here. Maple, smooth coffee without the bitter, chocolate without the sweetness being a bother, and a maple, brown sugar finish. I love everything about this beer. Didnt think I could enjoy a brown this much. I need more of this. Absolutely delicious.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2017 the aroma of caramel and roasted malt, coffee, brown chocolate, vanilla, toffee and toast... the taste is caramel and chocolate with bright tones of coffee and with notes of vanilla, toffee, brown sugar and port... sweet, bitter and dry aftertaste...

355ml bottle (thanks Mart). Clear chestnut color. Medium size, yellowish brown head, stays. Green beans, coffee, sweet and bit woody in aroma. Coffee, roast, bit of green beans in taste. Sweet and coffee in aftertaste. Soft carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2016 Bottle shared by Mart, thanks! Brown beer, tan head. Nose is coffeebeans, malt, chocolate and caramel notes. Flavor is sweetness with more coffee and caramel, nutty and dry finish with more caramel. Lingering coffee and chocolate.

Bottle (from mikkeller webshop). Pours brown. Aroma is coffee, malt, roast, some sweetness. Flavor is sweet and bitter, coffee, roast, malt, cocoa. Finish is sweet and roast bitter with some alcohol. Overall: very good.
Bottle into a snifter. Pours black with little head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate malts. Taste was sweet and easy to drink.

Bottle. Black. Chocolately malt bready nose. Sweetness, intensity, sone woodyness. Med full bodied. Good balnce, smooth, kinda easy for the abv. Chocolate in finish, bit woody dry, but good nontheless. Real nice drink.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

A 355ml bottle with a best by date of 31st January 2017 and poured into a Moonzen teku glass. It poured a clear dark brown colour with a nice two finger tanned head that had decent retention and left great lacing. Aromas of coffee, roasted malts, chocolate, caramel and lightly bready. Tastes similar to the aroma with roasty coffee, chocolate and caramel with a hint of vanilla and nuttiness on the finish. Smooth, medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall its a nice Brown Ale that doesnt feel like a 9% abv beer and drinks easily. Its one of the better Brown Ales around but not quite as good as Prairie Okie though (in my opinion), but that one is barrel-aged.

Clear, nearly black, thick light beige froth. Aroma has malt syrup, coffee, light wood and caramel. Malty, syrupy sweet flavour, cocoa, lots of cold coffee. Hints of vanilla, some alcohol warmth. Sippable but really too sweet and actually a little watery beneath all that malt syrup...
On tap at Sauced. Pours a dark brown color with a bit of head. Nice balance of malt and coffee. Medium sweetness. Alcohol well hidden.
Malts and coffeee in the aroma. Brown clear beer. Good head. Taste has a bit too much coffee. Very good Brown ale but a hint too much coffee for me.

Bottle from alko stockmann, oulu. Deep brown color, nice smooth tanned head. Aroma has sweet roasty notes, coffee, some fruity notes. Nice balanced body, coffee, roasty notes, some hoppy notes. Very nice.

Tap at @ Basement Beer Bar, Aalborg. Aroma of nutty malt, caramel, mild coffee, vanilla. Dark brown colour with tan head, mostly dim. Moderate sweet and light bitter. Medium+ full, oily feel and dark caramel finish.
Bottle - Dark brown pour with a tan head. Has a rich malty aroma. A nice mix of chocolate, coffee, caramel and toast. Has a smooth and rich mouthfeel. An excellent beer.

Bottle from beer club. Pours dark black with foamy head. Pretty much as advertised caramel, chocolate, coffee. Lingers on the palate. Tasted better is it warmed up. At 9% makes it a slow sipper

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Caoba rojizo limpio y espuma beis. Aromas de café espreso, nuez, fruto negro. Cuerpo denso y sabor de café, chocolate y galleta con final de amargor de tostado.
Bottle at home. Pours deep brown, nose is huge coffee, roasted malts, taste is chewy toffee, light chocolate, sweet, coffee.

(En fût au Bottlecraft Little Italy): Brutalité torréfiée et beaucoup de flocons céréaliers au nez. Le chocolat noir camouffle à peine lastringence du café à la première gorgée, ça se stabilise un peu ensuite. Riche, puissant et très amer.
Phenomenal! Simple yet complex! Smooth malty flavor profile with just the right amount of coffee. Excellent consistency and mouthfeel.

Bottle at Cafe Sara, june 9th 2016. Black body with a small tanned head. Aroma is roasty with almonds, malt and chocolate. Taste of coffee, cocoa, soasty bitterness, with a late sweetness tickling with nuts. Dark coffee finish. Quite good!

dark brown colour with ruby notes, one finger of creamy, yellowish-beige head; aroma of heavily roasted coffee, some dark chocolate, roasted nuts, hints of dried fruits and alcohol; taste is also dominated by coffee with syrupy sweetness, roasted (almost burnt) nuts and spicy alcohol, maybe some herbal-liqueur notes can also be felt; Im not sure if it is really an American strong ale, but Im sure that it would be a masterpiece of any style

DWF; Bottle 355ml., from Systembolaget, Karlstad. Pours a large, dark brown with a creamy, lasting and lacing light tan head. Nose is moderate, roasted, malt, coffee, chocolate, ash and light spinach. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a lasting, chocolate, ash finish. Body is full, texture is oily to creamy, carbonation is soft.
Nice dark brown! Little head brew but a big coffee taste with a good deal of malt and some caramel. This should be on your "Must Try" list, trust me...you wont be disappointed.

26-AUG-2016, bottle @home, from Kihoskh.
Dark amber with a lasting, off-white head. Huge coffee aroma. Taste the same with bread, caramel and chocolate. Alcohol, bitterness, sweetness, average+ carbonation. Nice.

Coffee ohoi matey. Lovely night cup.Black color with a solid tan head. Nice lacing! Looks really nice. Good intensity in the aroma. Coffee. Full body and a smooth carbonation. Good balance between sweetness and bitterness. Coffee, roast and some toffee in the flavor.[Bottle from Systembolaget web order in Sweden]
Bottle from Craft Beer Cellar Waterbury. Coffee and brown sugar aroma. Rich flavour, coffee, some chocolate, brown sugar. A great big brown ale.
On tap at Copenhagen Beer and Whisky Festival. Deep copper colour with a lasting off-white head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and caramel. Sweet caramel and coffee flavour.

Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av trä, kaffe, choklad, rostad malt, något nötig och karamellig. Rund och len, mjuka fina smaker i mycket bra balans. Lagom sötma, frisk och fruktig. Fin beska med goda kaffe aromer. Riktigt gott!
From tap. Dark brown colour with a beige. Aroma and flavour of malt, caramel, bitterness, alcohol and roasted notes.
Bottle. Bronze with ruby color. Aroma: real coffee, pie crust and a little brandy. Taste: coffee with cognac, roasted, caramel sweetness. Very good.

Kaffe är tydligt i både smak och doft. Doften innehåller även mörk chokladkola och knäck. I smaken kommer knäcken tillbaka, tillsammans med hasselnöt och mörk choklad. En mycket god öl, som säkerligen passar för lagring något eller några år. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark mahogany brown colour with beige head on top which leaves some lacing. Aroma has roasted malts, espresso coffee, chocolate. 
Taste has tobacco, espresso coffee, roasted malts, its like drinking cup of strong espresso coffee while smoking a cigar. Full oily texture with lowish carbonation.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Svart med ett litet skum. Kaffe i doft och smak. En habil pjäs men inget som lyfter till högre nivå, lite samma samma 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours dark brown. Large tan creamy head. Coffee aroma. Flavor is coffee & caramel with some nuts added in. Really nice beer. Great balance. Just enough sweet to balance the roast.

On tap at Scratch Bar. Dark brown with a thin beige head and strong coffee aroma. The coffee dominates the taste and palate along with a bit of chocolate. Hard to believe its 9% abv as the alcohol is well cloaked.

12 ounce bottle from a 6 pack purchased at Romeys Liquors in Woodland. There is a very nice roasted coffee aroma on this. Theres really not much else in the nose, which is fine. I would think a brown ale is a good beer to show off the aroma of the coffee. Transparent dark mahogany body with a medium, very persistent light tan head. Very attractive. Starts with a little metallic astringency, before plenty of coffee flavor comes through in the middle. Light roasted bitterness later on. This is all about the coffee, and they picked the perfect beer vehicle to show off the coffee. Lots of breweries will fuck this up and make it a totally acidic, astringent mess, but they did quite well with this. The finish is just a tad dry for me.

Bottle.
Pours brown with a tan head.
Aroma and taste of coffe, chocolate and a hint of licorice. Balanced.

My Bottom Line:
Iced coffee, earthen accents and toasted depths surf a caramelized nut base in this velvety, creamy concoction.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam covers the darkest brown.
-The nose is unadulterated coffee.
-The mouthfeel is super smooth.
-Finish is lightly bitter, with leafy nods and coffee lengths.
-All flavors are harmonious and captivating.
-Alcohol is a no show in the flavor profile.

Bottle.

12 oz bottle, bottled on 3/31/16. Pours brown with a big pillowy tan head that retains well and leaves a little lacing.

The aroma is sweet lactose and chocolate malt with lots of fudgy roast coffee and a bit of hazelnut.

The flavor is sweet milky chocolate malt with acidic roast coffee and some nuttiness and a lingering bitter finish. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with smooth carbonation.

Overall, a nice coffee beer. Id like it better if the sweetness and bitterness blended together better.
Poured into a goblet at The Pharmacy in Nashville on a nice afternoon after finishing a 3 day conference. Strong coffee smell. Very good.

BOTTLE. brown with ruby colour & thin off white head.. Big roasted coffee bean nose, some biscuit malt as well.. Biscuit and caramel malt body with a big coffee presence, finishes with solid bitter kick.. Sourced Cape Cellars
bottled, dark brown pour with minimal head, has a strong pressed coffee nose and flavor without green pepper or other off flavors , intense finish

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours dark brown with dirty white head, that leaves lacing. Aroma of ground coffee, green pepper, toffee and light chocolate. Slightly bitter coffee and caramel with some leather and cream. Well hidden alcohol.

Bottle 355ml. Served at cellar temperature. Pours dark brown with a ruby tint. Head is lightly tanned, average sized and lasts well in the glass. Aroma is rich and toasted with notes of earthy hops, burnt fudge, espresso, roasted malts, dark chocolate, caramel, raisins and hints of treacle. Flavour is a medium earthy hop bitterness with roasted barley, strong black coffee, bitter cooking chocolate, roasted nuts, leather, salted licorice, brown sugar (light), prunes (light), and smokey/charred notes in the finish. Full bodied with a silky texture and a great finish. ABV is well hidden. A very tasty and unique American Strong Ale  easily one of the best I have ever had!

Bottle shared by a friend. Pours a dark reddish chestnut brown with a thick tan head. Aroma of malt, green pepper, caramel and coffee. Malty and caramelly flavor giving way to slight green pepper with a creamy coffee and chocolate finish.

Bottle. Pours dark brown ruby with creamy and tanned head. Aroma is dry coffee beans, vanilla, honey?, chocolate, barley, ice cream. Palate is full and smooth. Taste is sweet vanilla, with a developing coffee bitterness and dryness with notes of nougat, chocolate, nuts. Awesome.

On tap at La Tape.
Average creamy beige head with medium retention.
Clear mahogany colour. Clean light brown when there is a little beer left.
Aroma is perfect soft black coffee. 
Taste is great coffee, roasted malt and great stout altogether.
Creamy palate, watery appearance.
Excellent coffee beer!

Tap
@ Irreale, Madrid, Spain.
A: Amber.
T: Roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, vanilla, bitter.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2016 From a 355ml bottle on 11/8/2016. Pours a deep, deep brown with a small head. The nose is lovely and all coffee. Flavour wise, its got heaps of sweet caramel, golden syrup, a hint of honey and spice,finished off by a moderate hop bitterness. The texture is slightly creamy and the carbonation average. This is really good stuff. Complex, harmonious, satisfying. Exhibits some similarities to the glorious Breakfast Stout.

Klar, röd-brun nästintill svart, litet gyllen brunt skum. Doft: Kaffe, rostat, kakao, lite bland juice, lite lätt av sött rödvin. Smak: Malt, rostat, kanderat/lätt bränt socker, fruktsoda, kola, milt mjukt kaffe, billig kakao. Lagrad maltig smak.
Clear dark brown with strong light tan head. Strong roasted malt and very bitter chocolate and coffee. Smoke, ash and the bitter chocolate. A thick palate and an alcoholy finish.

Smells of sweet roasted malts and smooth lushous coffee and a bit of bitter chocolate. Super rich really dark brown in color with one finger tan head that tends to last. Super sweet malts start off this great brew then tons of mocha coffee finishes off this ale with a touch of booze that is hardly noticeable. Full thick creamy body with cramey carbonation that coats the tougue nicely. Great complexity in this brown ale lots of flavor that comes out at the right time plus the creaminess is a plus. Nice work!

On tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Clear amber body, medium creamy off-white head. Aroma is caramel, nuts, nougat and hints of coffee, almonds and burnt sugar. Taste is nuts, nougat, caramel, vanilla, bitter herbs and hints of filter coffee, bread and astringent medicinal tones. Warming alcohol. Full body, medium carbonation. Weird. The coffee is rather subdued, and instead the astringent bitterness is quite overwhelming, even if there is a bit of sweet caramel hanging around. One of the worst Ive had from Founders, bit of a letdown.

August 7, 2016. Bottle from Systembolaget. 
Clear dark brown with some ruby red hints, small tan head.

Aroma is coffee forward with coffee beans on top on a slight earthy and sweet malty base with caramel, toffee, notes of vanilla, light notes of dried fruits and chocolate. Taste is medium sweet, a bit earthy, light bitter roastiness. Bitter earthy and fruity coffee finish with some sweet toffee and caramel. Medium bodied, soft carbonation.

Kólaszínű testű, piszkosfehér presszóhabot gerjesztő főzet harsány és változatos kávéaromákkal, fekete földes bukéval, kesernyés hangulatot árasztó jegyekkel. Jól rétegzett ízvilág, sokszínű malátás alapokon nyugszik, a kávé karaktere remekül tetézi a pörkölt, enyhén karcos, mégis krémes egyveleget adó elemek sötét tónusú szerkezetét. Mindehhez közepes teltség és hosszan tartó kesernyés zárás társul, s az igazsághoz az is hozzátartozik, hogy a Ratebeer szerinti american strong ale jelleg már csak a felsorolt jellemvonások alapján is erősen megkérdőjelezhető.

The flavor is wonderful and only coffee. The same applies to the taste. Lovely bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Really good coffee beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Pours very dark brown with a nougat colored hed. Aroma; Rich on coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate, cocoa, some toffee and vanilla. Taste; Coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt,caramel and vanilla

How : bottle Appearance : almost clear nice brown color with a red shine, medium tanned head. Aroma : intense cold brew smell, chocolate, caramel, dried fruits and nuts. Palate : medium body, soft carbonation.
Bottle from SB. Dark brown with a medium tan head. Fruity and roasted tones. Malt, coffee, fruit and hops. Full body with a nice bitter sweet roasted finish.

Pours a very dark brown with a massive foamy tan mocha head. Aromas of dark chocolate, heavily roasted malt, coffee beans, slight vanilla, brown sugar. Taste is very much about the coffe and the chocolate and malt structure that supports it. Some nutty notes as well. Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
Bottle @ home, from Kihoskh. Pours dark brown almost black with a frothy light tan head. Tons of fresh coffee, toasty, light sweetness, some dark fried fruits and a light bitter finish. Pretty good!

355ml bottle from Systembolaget. Almost black colour with brown two-finger head, quickly disappearing though. Nose is rich roasted coffee, dark chocolate and sweet toffeeish malt. No off-flavours or watery mouthfeel - this is imperial! Balanced. Hop and black coffee bitterness with clear black chocolate notes are nicely welded together and they form long smooth finish.

Rostad malt, kaffe, choklad, sötma, mörkbrun med lätt krämigt skum, dold alkoholsmak trots relativt hög ABV. Gillas!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

35,5 cl bottle @ home. BBE 31.01.2017
Aroma has vegetables typical to coffee beers and some mocha. Also pea soup. Flavour has mocha, chocolate and hints of the pea soup. Finishes with some sharp-ish alcohol. Aroma was not that nice but luckily flavour is not that bad. A slight disappointment though, the vegetable notes typical to coffee beers take over the flavour bouquet after some sips.

By taste Id call this imperial porter/stout, this is somewhat far from american strong ale. As RB lacks the imperial brown ale category.

Tasting @ fillepolo 20160804. Bottle (355 ml) from Systembolaget. Roasted malty with chocolate and coffee, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and roasted with coffee and chocolate.
Beer tasting @ fillepolo 4/8-16. Bottle from Systembolaget. A lot of coffee/coffee ground also chocolate and some roasted malts. Body is medium, the finish is dry with coffee/coffee grounds.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a dark Brown colour beer with small head. Coffee in both aroma and taste some roasted malts, chocolate and vanilla. Dry finish

Bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy very dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt, caramel and heavy coffee. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish with a little warming alcohol. Oily and soft. 030816

(355ml bottle from Systembolaget) Pours clear deep mahogany with a moderate cream head without lace. Aroma of dark roast coffee with earth, bakers chocolate, muscovado, vanilla, dark rye bread, light ash, slightly acidic nature to the roast. Flavours of cold brew coffee, muscovado, caramel, slight cola, very earthy, hints of dates, nuts, quite toasted but initially semi-sweet. Gets extremely dry towards the finish, lots of roast coffee and toasted malts, unsweetened liquorice, earth, slightly ashy and leafy. Powdery aftertaste with roasted coffee and earth persisting. Slight alcohol warmth in the back end. Medium bodied, with fine mouth filling carb. This is pretty much all coffee, but that is pretty clearly the point. Full deep flavours of Sumatran beans provide good structure with malt supporting.

355ml Bottle - Dark brown in colour. Coffee, liquorice and some earthy notes in the aroma. Roasted and earthy taste with coffee dominating but some notes of liquorice and chestnuts can also be detected. Some slightly caramelly and buttery notes can be detected in the finish.
Dark coffee roasted notes, bitter chocolate, a little acidic, a little fruit and definitely not sweet. The result is a full, rich coffee brown ale.

draft sampler that poured a dark brown with tan head. huge coffee/espresso nose followed by a chocolate malt source either cocoa powder or nibs or whatever but its awesome. very deep and rich. not a coffee drinker but this beer is delicious with the base of a deep chocolate stout with huge espresso/coffee flavors. almost bought a bottle awhile back but held off now I am glad it had it on draft first this is really tasty.

Pours mahogany tinged deep brown into a snifter. Mocha head with little retention recedes to hug rim. Sweet chocolate syrup and coffee aromas. Astringent with sweet chocolate and caramel upfront turning to espresso before the dusty bitter cocoa finish.

Bottle, 9%. Very dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, coffee, strong coffee and vegetables. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, strong coffee, vegetable, caramel, sweet, hop, little but, toasted and a little bitter.

Draught at Ølbaren.
Dark brown colored with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and light roasted roasted flavor of caramel and coffee.
Fruity flavor of caramel and coffee with notes of chocolate.
Fruity finish.

Flaska från SB. Mörkt brun, valnötsträ typ, medelhögt beige skum som inte lämnar rester. Stor kaffedoft, choklad, rostade nötter. 33 cl bottle from SB. Pours dark brown/black with creamy beige head. Aroma of coffee, fudge, caramel, chocolate, alchohol, a bit of dried fruit. Medium sweet with coffee bitterness in the finish. Medium body with a oily texture, not much carbonation.

Deep brown with a decent but quickly fading tan head. Coffee, toffee and milk chocolate on the nose. Taste is similar, sweet milky chocolate/coffee, caramel. Theres bitter coffee and slightly hoppy notes at the end that dont make it *too* sweet

Pours dark brown with a large head.

4 finger tan head, brown body. Nose: Coffee, caramel, roasted malt, dark roasted coffee and Kaluha. Taste: Coffee, roasted malt, caramel, raisins, dates, a hint of Kaluha, unsweet licorice, milk-chocolate, dark chocolate and raw chocolate nibs. 
Long, dry, semi-bitter ending

355ml bottle. Dark brown with one finger beige head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malts, light spicy green peppers, cocoa and black bread. Taaste is intense cold coffee, roasted malts, black bread, light ash and cocoa. Medium mouthfeel, medium to strong carbonation and strong cold coffee aftertaste.

Flaska från SB. Mörk kolabrun, nästan intill svart, med beiget försvinnande skum. I doften syrliga rågtoner från välrostad malt (a la brown ale) tillsammans med islatte och mocca. Även kola, choklad, pumpernickel och torkad frukt, typ fikon och dadlar. Stor kropp som sväller i munnen. Smakmässigt kola, kandisocker, lite hetta och sting från alkoholen jämte en relativt märkbar beska. Även gräddkola och choklad. Mindre kaffe än väntat. I smaken framträder det främst i eftersmaken, men då ganska subtilt. Hade nästan hoppats på en större släng kaffe. Rör sig i gränslandet till vad jag skulle kalla en Old Ale.
355ml bottle. Dark brown body with a medium head. Caramell, coffee, heavily roasted malt, figs, syrup. Lovely.

Quite the spectacular ale. Layers of sweet smells in the aroma, though the coffee does overwhelm. The weight is amazing. It seems it should be syrupy because of the many sweet tastes, but it is delightfully light. Just a slight snap of bitterness in a mostly malty finish. Enjoyed on tap at Milwaukees Odd Duck.

355 ml bottle. Deep dark brown colour, thin off-white head. Sweet aroma of chocolate, coffee and toasted malt. The flavour is sweetish, malty, with coffee, milk chocolate, notes of caramel and nuts, and a warm, moderately bitter finish. Aftertaste of cocoa and coffee. Very nice.

Bottle from Systembolaget.

Black with a medium head. A lot of coffee both in the aroma and taste. Also chocolate and some toffee. Sweet but with a nice balance. Tasty.
Draught. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Dark brown colour. Heavy malty and moderate hoppy arom. Moderate bitter flavir. Long moderate bitter fiish. Creamy palate. Nice.

Coffee, chocolate, vanilla, coffee beans, alcohol, light berries, roasty, but somehow soft yet very rich.
Dark Brown colour, medium beige head, lacing.
Pronounced sweetness, light bite, salt and With some umani, ABV well integrated.
Fullbodied, soft carbonation, long warming finish.
Superb.
Bottle:Dark brown with a small head.Big coffee aroma with biscuits, toffee and chocolate.Dry coffee flavor with notes of toffee, chocolate and a little bit of licorice. Warming alcohol finish.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2017 Dark brown with thick beige head. Aroma of sweet malts, strong chocolate, coffee and caramel. Full bodied, sweet malty flavor with intense coffee and chocolate. Smooth and easy to drink. Nice beer, especially for coffee lovers

From tap. Pours dark brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malty and slight breadish. Coffee, herbal, chocolate and dark malty. Dark malty, roasted, chocolate. Roasted, bitter and dark malty finish.
@ Basunen 16-7-16: mycket bra doft och smak av kaksmet, kaffe och kakao. Fin balans.

4-Pack of 12 ounce bottles - $10.99 at Bullocks Wine & Spirits in Marietta, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours a very dark reddish-brown body with a thick cap of dense beige suds. Scant lacing.

Smell: A sweetish mix of nutty caramel, semi-sweet chocolate, sugar-sweetened coffee and brown sugar.

Taste: Charred, crisp toast crusts caked with dark brown sugar and plump raisins. A small dash of chocolate powder. Sharp, bitter coffee taste blunted by a splash of cream. Stays sweet through the creamy finish with just a small ounce of heat to it.

Mouthfeel: Medium-plus body. Medium carbonation.

Overall: A decadent, malty brew infused with a bold coffee flavor.

Pours dark brown to black with low light tan head. Aroma of coffee, roasted notes, chocolate, vanilla, cedar wood. Taste is sweet, chocolate and vanilla, with a roasty coffee and cedar wood finish. Body is medium to rich and smooth with soft to average carbonation.

Pours dark brown with low tanned head
Aromas intense of coffee, roasted maltsmilk chocolate, brown sugar, hints of fudge
Taste has notes of milk chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, hints of hazelnuts
Mouthfeel is medium bodied, sweet and carbonated, low bitterness
Doftar mycket choklad. Mörkbrun med med liten skumkrona. Smakar mycket kaffe som ligger länge kvar i munnen!

355ml bottle from Systembolaget. Deep dark brown with a medium size tanned head, good lacing. Rich coffee aroma, caramel, tobacco and hints of sweet dark dried fruit. Smooth creamy mouthfeel, mild carbonated. Hazelnut and toffee taste with roasted coffee beans and rosted malt, toast, grass and some sweet molasses. Dry, grassy finish. Very enjoyable!

Bottle at a tasting in Billdal 160721. Almost black color with a nice lasting beige head. Coffee beans aroma, cocoa powder, dark chocolate, fruity, some burnt wood. Coffee flavor, dark chocolate, espresso, cocoa powder, slightly spicy. Nice coffee infused beer.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Dark brown with a beige head. 
Loads of sourish coffee-beans in the aroma. 
Light body. 
Roasted with some coffee and more chocolate. Some dried fruits.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours very dark wooden brown with a frothy mocha head that leaves plenty of sticky lacing and trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty and earthy with dark bread, caramel, toffee, light roast aromatic coffee, hay, moist soil, dried bilberries, wood and hints of alcohol. Taste is slightly sweet, slightly bitter, malty, roasty and earthy. Mouthfeel is round, tiny astringent, tiny boozy and medium. Finish is sweet and bitter with caramel, toffee and berry rich aromatic coffee. I remember Frangelic as better with its nuttiness but this is damn tasty too. Coffee browns are hard to pull off but this is nice.

Coca cola-brun öl med ett lättare mörkbeige skum. Doft och smak av rostat kaffe, karamell och lättare toner av mörk choklad. De rostade tonerna är starkare i smaken än i doften. Lättare toner av aska i smaken.

Deep red/brown with a very thin mocca head. Aroma is malt sweetness and roasted coffee beans. Taste is smooth and devine with a slightly bitter coffee finish. Yet another fantastic brew from Founders. I wonder how amazing a barrel aged version of this could be...
33 cl bottle from systembolaget. Pours brown with little head. Sweet roasted aroma with loads of coffee taste. Burnt sugar and coffee through after taste.

Bottle from Alko. Pours almost black with small tan head. Aroma has a lot of coffee, also some brown sugar, cocoa & chocolate. Taste has also a lot of coffee, some alcohol, but not too much, some bitter chocolate. Dry beer. It is like a coffee explosion.
Dark brown. Nice aroma of mocha, brown sugar, slight cocoa, cold press coffee. Thick and malty, slight sweetness, long coffee bitter finish. Nice one
Typical good performance from founders. Nice coffee flavour, not overpowering.

Black colour, mediumsized brown head. Aroma is coffee, some nuts, alcohol, mild roasted malts as well as some alcohol. Flavour is coffee, roasted malts and some nutty notes. Long espresso aftertaste.

Tap into a shaker showing almost opaque coffee brown with sparse white foam. 

The nose shows a strong roasted dry coffee forwardness. First time Ive said this, but you could probably fool a blindfolded person that this is actually roasted ground coffee. 

The palate is moderately carbonated and light bodied. Strong roasted coffee notes throughout with a very light lactose sweetness that brightens the entire beer. Despite producing such high volumes, Founders quality never seems to falter. Another great beer.

Bottle from Total Wine in Sacramento, CA. Pours dark brown with a light tan head. Aroma is essentially very nice coffee. Med + body. Flavor is sweet caramel, coffee, and perhaps a touch of chocolate. Not very dry, but somewhat coffee bitter. Its suggestive of candy! Delicious.
Tap at Flying Saucer, Nashville, 14th July 16. Pours dark brown, aroma is candy, caramel, burnt sugar, malts. Taste is rich, boozy, dark malts, dark fruit, molasses. Good fun
On tap at Industry. Pours a dark amber with small beige head leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is cocoa and roast. Thick, chewy, roast, chocolate, light dry finish, very good.

Bottle. A dark brown, almost black beer with a finger-thick light beige head. Lots of delicious coffee aroma escapes the glass immediately after I start pouring. Really deliciout. The coffee got company of dark chocolate and some caramel, a touch of toffee, a little nuttyness and brown sugar. Perhaps a wee whiff of bonfire too. Its full-bodied and quite smooth on the palate, with a light warmth and a good sweetness. Not sticky though. Theres lots of delicious coffee in the flavor too, with a nice roasted sweetness as a backdrop for nuts, caramel sauce, toffee, dark chocolate and a pleasant bitterness. The finish is of the everlasting kind, blending coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts, caramel sauce and bitterness very nicely, and adding a twist of grass, herbs and pecan. A lovely beer indeed, dangerously easy drinkablee when fridge cold, and a pure pleasure to drink when it warms up a bit. Lovin it. 160717

Tap at Yard House Houston. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, roast, and chocolate ice cream. Taste is rich, moderately sweet, mildly bitter, and full of coffee; a bit like chocolate ice cream with loads of coffee flavor. Almost black appearance with a heavily lacing, resilient, fluffy khaki head. Full bodied and creamy. Excellent.

From a 12oz. bottle. Pours a deep, almost opaque mahogany color with a small tan head. The nose is roasted malts and coffee. Taste is very coffee forward with roasted malts on the side followed by a nice touch on bitterness. The alcohol is well hidden. Very nice!

Pours a very dark, nearly opaque brown with a couple of fingers of off-white head. Vigorous bouquet with loads of heavy coffee. Theres also some coffee, and did I mention coffee? If youre a fan of the black stuff, this is certainly going to be up your alley. Barely detectable is also some scents of vanilla and some roasted malts. The palate is medium+ bodied, and a little less expressive than I would have expected or liked it to be. Moderate bitterness and medium finish. If this was slightly more complex on the nose, and more expressive on the taste, it would be an absolute cracker. Still very tasty though.

Bottle from local SB Eriksberg cons 2016-07-16 Göteborg
AR: sweet maple syrup, coffey - fruit variant, apple dipped in caramel
AP: deep ruby, stouthy cream brown steady lid
F: rich carbonation, fruity coffey, sweet mouthfeeling, wee dryness, sticky caramel
0,33l bottle from Alko, Joensuu. Pours cloudy dark brown with a medium off-white head. Aroma is roasted malts and coffee. Flavor is deep roasted malts, alcohol, coffee and hops. Very nice indeed.

Bottle. Black coffee, chocolate malt, and hay aroma. Black with large tan head. Moderately sweet earthy coffee, dark chocolate malt, and moderately bitter herbal hay flavor. Nice body and balance. A great coffee beer.

Mycket mörkt rubinröd med stort ljusbrunt skum. I doften finns massor av kaffe plus mörk choklad och vanilj. Kraftig kaffesmak och riktigt mörk choklad, mörkt bröd, vanilj, lite knäck och riktigt mörka bär. Stor och mjuk munkänsla. En riktigt häftig imperial brown ale.

Draft to taster at the brewpub. Looks solid; a cloudy caramelish brown with foamy light beige head. Smells of chocolate, caramel, coffee, and mild hops and roast with a moderately semi-sweet backbone. Tastes like it smells with a somewhat bitter medium full-bodied mouthfeel. Solid.
UPDATED: JUL 26, 2016 Clear brown color, small beige head. Aromas of caramel, toffee, coffee and chocolate. Coffee and toffee taste. Thin body. Slight bitter coffee finish. A bit one-dimensional.

A very dark beer, a mahongy brown, a head is dense, medium and beige. Aroma has strong coffee, chocolate and sweetness of malts. Powerful. Taste has chocolate and coffee, richness of malts are smoothening the taste, some liquirice. Medium+ bodied, very smooth and pleasant to mouth. The great beer where the strong coffee is perfectly balanced with other elements. Very tasteful. The beer for coffee lovers.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2016 355 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Dark brown with a medium brown head. Strong aroma of burnt coffee, caramel, roasted malt, followed by notes of choclate and dried fruits. Taste reflects the aroma, but more maltiness. Medium body. Medium bitterness. Medium carbonation.

Bottle from Alko. Dark brown color, white head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, coffee, toffee, nuts, a hint of smoke, chocolate and vanilla. Bitter finish with roasted malts, nuts, coffee, vanilla, chocolate and toffee. Exquisite imperial brown ale.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2016 Bottle picked up at Elevated and consumed with commonshawn. Poured into 12 oz glass. Reddish brown color with a sight haze and some sediment presence. Nose is predominantly nutty, roasty coffee elements. A malty, almost caramel characteristic as well. Taste carries the coffee banner through consumption. There are some good roasted malt notes with a caramel/toffee syrup undertone. Hop bitterness waits until the end to come into play. Mouthfeel is relatively  medium-bodied which surprised me slightly. Expected a fuller quality. This is one geared towards a coffee fan so it?s not a complete win for me. I enjoyed summitting this mountain once but that?s probably enough.

Bottle from elevated with commonmac. Root beer dark brown with medium white head and some sediment. Smells of sugary coffee. Complex and tasty. Sugar, with spice burn, fairly high alcohol. Some bitterness layered in. Syrupy. Very full body. Somewhat murky. Lot of flavor here. Actually liked it a little better when first poured vs after it warmed a bit. A mountain worth climbing

Dark brown pour with a creamy lush beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, caramel, hint of chocolate and hops. Taste of roasted malts, coffee, slight chocolate , caramel, slight nuttiness, and a touch of hop bitterness on the finish. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, medium carbonation, perfectly balanced. Excellent beer!

Bottle 355ml @ Sommerhuset
Pours dark reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, grain, chocolate, peanuts and coffee. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long nutty, caramel, chocolate and coffee finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Flaska från SB. Coca-Cola svart med smutsgrå skumkrona. Doft av kaffe och mörk toffe. Halvfyllig kropp med torr avslutning. Smak av kaffe, rostad malt, knäck och choklad.

Flaska systembolaget. Mörkbrun kulör. Doft av kallt kaffe, farinsocker och rostad malt. 
Maltig och rostad smak med kraftig kaffeton. Torr i gom
Flaska från SB. Väldigt mörkbrun med lite beige skum. Kraftig kaffedoft. Lätt munkänsla med kaffe och lite kola i smaken.

Aroma of loads of cappucino, nuts, roast, baked bread. 
Pours almost completely black with a small beige head that lasts well. 
Taste is sweet coffee with a nice roasty bitterness behind it. Quite balanced but a tad to the sweeter side. Medium plus body, creamy, soft carbonation, finish of nice sweet coffee, wood and roast. Very unique taste. Go get it.

On tap at The Daily Pint. Deep dark brown with a moderate short-lived brown head. Wonderful aromas of strong coffee with chocolate, caramel, roasted malt and hints of dark fruit. Coffee flavors dominate, accompanied by dark chocolate with a hint of earth in the background. Full body, minimal carbonation, silky smooth mouthfeel and a lingering coffee roast in the finish. Just outstanding.
Tap @ Konttori. Pours black with a beige head. Strong coffee, chocolate, vanilla aroma. Sweet, coffee, chocolate, smooth flavor.

It pours dark brown with a brown moderate head. It has a deep, powerful coffee aroma with low caramel, and hints of dark fruit. It has flavors of coffee that dominates with caramel, dark fruit, and chocolate in the background. It has a moderate body that is sharply bitter and an light alcohol warming finish.

12 oz. bottle from Country Fresh Market on Beechmont. Pours a hazy dark chestnut brown with a modest beige head that settles into a lasting ring and island of film, leaving a couple ropes of trailing lace in the glass. Im surprised by the amount of yeast sediment in this. This one was bottled on 4/5/16, so I was a little worried about its condition three months out, but its still in great shape. Very nice roasted coffee up front in both aroma and flavor, with nuts, chocolate, earth, mild tobacco - the coffee leads the way but isnt biting or overpowering. Medium-bodied, with a roasty mouthfeel that lingers a bit. Moderate carbonation. This had been getting very good reviews and lives up to the buzz.
12oz bottle into phish pint glass. Pours a dank Crayola brown. Caramel head, retains well. Aroma of hoppy grass, malt field, coffee. Sweet coffee after kick. Large abv, friendly going down. Nice

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2016 Draft at Bru Craft. Silky dark brown/black pour with hints of garnet. Thin lasting layer of beige foam. Transient splashes of lace. Bitter dark roasted malts. Distinct strong coffee. Burnt cocoa nibs. Black currants. Liquorice. Hints of vanilla, charcoal and smoke. Burnt cocoa nibs. Spicy finish. Would love to try a barrel aged version of this.

Dark brown medium bodied head. Big bad aromas of coffee, caramel, toffee, big dark chocolate, roast, and spicy hops. Flavors of coffee, toffee, dark chocolate, roast, spicy hop, caramel. Medium to high sweetness, low smoke aftertaste. Reminds of a coffee stout I made years ago.

12 oz bottle. BB 31/01/17. From my lovely wife.
Dark reddish brown color with a small tan head.

Tap @ Konttori.
Pours black color with a huge, creamy beige head. Chocolate and soft cocoa notes on the nose, toasted malts, faint orange notes, mild hops and vanilla, fair amount of coffee too. From: Bine & Vine in Normal Heights (San Diego), Calif.
