Consumed: July 2, 2016
Misc.: Bottled on May 16, 2016 at 1:24 p.m. ET

Had been wanting to try this for a long time, at least since I started seeing it on every single beer website Id been going to. I love Founders. I love coffee beer. I love boozy beer. 

Poured a reddish brown amber, semi-clear color with 3-to-4 fingers of rocky, khaki tan head. Very good foamy, uneven lacing. Outstanding retention. (Sight - 4.00)

Smelled black coffee (guessing Sumatra), roasty malts, bitter black coffee beans, ashtray, char wood, toasted toffee, hazelnut and very dark chocolate. (Smell - 4.00)

Tasted slightly better than the nose, getting Sumatra coffee (Im guessing thats Sumatra), Kona coffee, hazelnut, roasty malts, black coffee, bitter black coffee beans, ashtray, smoky fire, char wood, roasted toffee and toasted caramel. (Taste - 4.25)

Medium body. Creamy texture. Average carbonation. Long, bitter finish. (Feel - 4.25)

This was a really good coffee-style beer. Couldnt imagine having a six-pack of this, but still nice. (Overall - 4.25)

4.18 93 A-
Very strong coffee flavor-full bodied as well. Dark brown, almost black in the glass. Lingering alcohol taste

12 oz bottle. Pours a dark brown with a thin off-white head. Aroma is lots of coffee, roast, vanilla, toffee, and some cocoa. Flavor is coffee, roast, chocolate, and sweet toffee and caramel notes. A little alcohol burn at the finish.
July 2, 2016 - bottle split with the family. Dark brown pour with some head that lasted. Aroma was chocolate, coffee and slight peppers. Taste was chocolate, coffee and slight amount of heat.

12oz bottle from CBC. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is strong coffee, slightly overextracted grounds. Flavor is caramel, dark coffee, a hint of overextracted grounds in the finish. Good full mouthfeel.
On tap at Dunkworths. Clear dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is nice coffee, medium body, lower carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is nuts and coffee. As much a stout as a brown ale.
Deep brown, ruby highlights. Beige moderate head. Nice lacing. Massive coffee, roasted malts. Medium body. Brandy, coffee on taste. Just perfect.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

At cellar temperature and into a snifter. Deepest ruby and radiant in the lights. Head is a compact quarter inch of off-white foam that holds tight for the length with little lace. Husky, rough and earthy, roasted coffee bean nose with hints of sodden loam, paperbark, tobacco and tannic black tea. Cold filtered coffee is all I get on the palate. Where is the imperial brown ale I so hoped to find!? Light to creamy/foamy in feel. A hint of earth, dust, rust, dirt, but pretty much just unpercolated, heavily roasted coffee beans. Just disappointing in its lack of depth from the base ale. Boring!!!! (35,5cL,BB 31/01/17, The Liquor Shed, Jandakot)

Poured from bottle dated 3/31/16 dark brown pour with an off white head and nice lacing. Aromas of coffee caramel roasted malt and nuts. Taste is nice medium mouth feel balanced caramel coffee and malty notes. Well done.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 0,355l bottle from Alko. Aroma has a lot of coffee, dark roast, slightly roasted malt, some caramelly sweetness, dried fruits, some bitterness, a bit ashy. More coffee than sweetness. Medium body. Quite stout-like brown ale.
Cocoa and coffee. Huge beer. Sweet vanilla and chocolate taste. Coffee dominates though. Very good. Draft pour at She'll Beach Brewhouse.

355ml bottle. 
Bbe 31/01/2017. 
Poured dark brown color with a thick off white head, nice lacing. 
Coffee beans, roasted malt, nutty notes in aroma. Lovely. 
Coffee dominates of course accompanied by roasted, slightly ashy notes at times. Cocoa powder as well as nuts. Feels even a bit light perhaps. Dry finish with a loong finish of strong brewed coffee. Lovely coffee beer. Mix of brown ale and porter.
Bottle @ Skovhaven took it. Pours nearly black with a creamy head. Coffee and cream. Dry roasted - brilliant coffee - perhaps cold - sorry Scheffel. Smooth and dry. Tasty!
Bottle at skovenhaven took it. Pours hazy brown with tan head. Aroma of coffee, chewy, dark choco, nutty, chewy caramel. Taste is rather sweet, with loads of coffee and chewy caramel. Good stuff!

Tasted from bottle. Pours a dark brown with a khaki head. Aroma is big time fresh brewed coffee. Maybe a hint of cocoa. Taste is incredibly balanced. Not overly sweet, nice bitterness. Flavors of coffee, chocolate, caramel, toffee. Really nice flavor. As usual from Founders and exceptional beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from a trade. Thanks Jared! Dark black brown colour, brown foam. Intense roasty nose of coffee roasted malts along with caramel malts (sweetness). Bitter and sweet very well balanced. Good

Bottle. Dark mahogany in color with a tan head. Notes of coffee beans and brown sugary sweetness in aroma. Some vinous notes too. Bit dry mouthfeel. Coffee and cocoa powder in taste. Leaning to the sweeter side in finish, even if the bitter chocolate is present as well.

355ml bottle.
Deep mahogany/copper, beige head.
Smooth, roasted aroma, loads of coffee beans, licorice, caramel, malt, hops, citrus, chocolate, fudge.
Dry, full bodied, mid to high bitterness, creamy CO2.
Rich, complex, roasted taste, coffee beans, vanilla, caramel, malt, citrus, hops, ashes, licorice, chocolate.
Long, smooth finish, the coffee lingers, There is a small tendency towards the astringent, but it manages to steer clear of that. Close to awesome. (2016-06-30)

Bottle - Cola pour with a filmy light tan head. Nose is caramel mixed with nutty, light roast coffee. Theres a little milkiness and vanilla in there too. Taste is similar, with the coffee and roasty malt taking center stage and the vanilla milkiness on the finish. Its a little bitter for my tastes and the 9% heat really comes through on the finish. But its pleasant and isnt a style you see every day. I love seeing beers like this become shelf beers--what a lovely beer world we live in!
Taas perusteosta vähän parempaa tekemistä. Kahvia on kesäksi liikaa, mutta hyvä on.
Sample at a Systembolaget tasting. Strong malty smell of coffee, mocha and chocolate. Lots of coffee in the taste and in the background roasted malts and caramel.

Black, cola-like body with a nice tan head, Aroma has a lots of malt, brown sugar, and caramel, Very rich in flavour, malts, some chocolate ,coffee. Mouthfeel is soft but rich, really nice. Pretty good overall.

On tap at Brunzies. Nice sweet coffee aroma, like a piece of coffee candy - very nice aromatics. Dark brown clear with thin creamy lacing off-white head. Medium body with medium carbonation. Sweet with tons of coffee flavor and a sugary pop. Bit nutty sweet coffee finish and lingering sweet coffee after. Almost cloying.

Bottle from Beltramos in Menlo Park, CA. Aroma is coffee and sweet caramel. Taste is the same...absolutely one of the best coffee beers Ive had. Loads of coffee flavor with amazing creamy caramel. SUPPPERBBBB!
Rich, thick imperial brown ale with chocolate sweet- and bitterness, coffeenotes and a wonderful mouthfeel. Great beer.

355 ml, bottled. Pours dark reddish brown with a small beige head. Aroma: Malt, chocolate, coffee. Hints of fruitiness. Taste: Medium sweet, bitter. Coffee, chocolate. Dark cocoa. Palate: Medium body, dry. Coffee. Dry finish. Not bad coffee ale.
Keg at Akkurat, Stockholm.  Black, creamy head. Rich coffee aroma. Sweet with full body and well rounded mouthfeel. Lots of coffee and chocolate, some fudge. Espresso finish. Rich and pleasant.

Pours a finger and half of tan head on a black body.
Aroma is coffee and milk.
Taste mild coffee, roasted malt and a little burnt wood.
Texture is crisp.
Enjoyable.

Hard core coffee yes!! Morning beer yes. It is a wonderful coffee beer !!! It is earthy and true to the label. Q

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

With Z, pours a rich dark brown color with a nice brown head. Nose is deep joe with sweet chocolate notes. Taste is sweet coffee with chocolate notes and heavy malt . Finish is thick and velvety and ends on the same sweet coffee chocolate notes. Nice ! Quaff Score 8 / 10

Bottle. Pours a dark brown with a tan head and strong coffee, mocha aroma. Taste is full of roasted coffee beans up front, with espresso and cocoa notes, into the light bitter finish. Delicious coffee brew
Tap @ Savory Grain. Very dark with oatmeal head. Smells earthy and lightly chocolate and lightly astringent. Nice coffee & bitter flavor.

12 oz. bottle. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of Sumatra coffee and chocolate. Taste is coffee, chocolate, and dark malts. Very roasty. Its good, but would be better if the coffee flavor wasnt quite so strong.

Pours a dark brown color with tan colored head. Coffee, cocoa, bread, and dark roasts on the nose; follows on to the palate. Full bodied. Finishes with coffee and a bit of sweetness, probably from the added malt bill.

Tap at Ale Arsenal. Entering a lot of old notes and realizing I was on quite a roll for great beer about a month ago! Complex malt aroma with a dark brown and tan head. Rich maltness leads to a full mouthfeel.
Draft at brass tap in St Pete, FL. Jet black. No head. Smells like cigarettes. Tastes like crappy old coffee, not the rich cocoa most beers go for. Not sure why this was listed as a brown

355ml bottle. Pours black-brown in colour with a creamy looking off-white foam head leaving lots of lacing. Aroma is malty, with chocolate, coffee and tobacco notes. The taste is rich dark malts, bready, sweetish, chocolate & coffee, dried fruits, raisins, some herby & spicy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry warming malt & coffee finish. Nicely drinkable.
Aroma is fresh ground coffee, spices and a hint of hops. The flavor is coffee, malts/dark malts, mild chocolate and a mix of light hop bitterness and acidity in the finish.
Dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Rich malty palate with predominant coffee notes alongside toasted malt flavors. Full body. Lingering coffee and slightly bitter finish.

Bottled. Pours deep brown with an average beige head. Aroma of chocolate, cocoa and toasted nuts. Sweet flavor that ends up being slightly more dry and with bitter notes. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Brown. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Tap at Beer Hunters. Dark brown color, small beige head. Strong coffee, coffee beans aroma. Medium-bodied. Very coffeish, cocoa, chocolate. Roasted "Sumatra" aftertaste. Mellow, hides abv very well. Great brew.

Bottle. Murky mahogany with a tall, fluffy tan head. Nose is oily coffee beans, toasted malt and light nuttiness. Taste is dark, bold coffee beans, cocoa, chocolate covered nuts, toasted malt and candy bars. Body is medium with a dense, bubbly carbonation. Lingering coffee bitterness and oiliness as well. Ends with more bold coffee, chocolate covered nuts, dark oil coffee beans and toasted malt. Yummy!

Bottle.

A- Tootsie rolls, coffee, chocolate.

A- Dark brown color, dark liquid, light brown head.

T- Coffee, chocolate, tootsie rolls, slightly bitter, slightly roasty.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, balanced finish.

O- If there was ever a beer that tasted like a liquid tootsie roll I imagine this would be the one. Lots of chocolate. Almost more than coffee, which is definitely there but not overwhelming. Overall its just a tasty brew and there are no two buts about it.

On tap @ Harrys Hofbrau - San Leandro. Brown in color with a khaki head. This is like those iced coffee drinks that are actually milkshakes. There is a good coffee thing going on, but also vanilla, condensed milk, and spices. Fair amount of toast and a hint of caramel. Really does have a nice, intense coffee character, though. I enjoyed a small pour of it.

Pours an opaque black with an average sized tan head that leaves some lacing. Heavy aromas of coffee, dark chocolate and roasted malt. Tastes of overpowering coffee and not much else; they could have gone a little lighter on the coffee and balanced it out with a bit more sweetness. Full-bodied with a bitter espresso-like finish. Overall it is pretty good but was just a little too strong on the coffee for me (yes I know it is a coffee beer but Jesus they went overboard IMO).

12oz bottle from Willows Market. Ah, the isle of Sumatra, the pearl of Indonesia. Brings me back to my childhood home on the coffee plantations southeast of Medan. I worked long days in the fields picking beans before coming home to a cold glass of imperial coffee brown. No wait, I forgot, that didnt happen. I grew up in a hick town in Pennsylvania and I drank Bankers Club vodka and "lager" as a kid. The beer pours a dark chestnut brown with a lasting khaki head. Two separate bottles had a weird brown slimy yeast/coffee thing that was a little disconcerting. Great coffee aroma, toffee, dates, and nuts. The flavor is somewhat sweet, yet balanced with coffee bitterness. Quite well-rounded. Medium-full bodied, only slightly syrupy, which is better than lots of recent Founders beers Ive had. Enjoyable.

Dark red brown beer with light brown head. Looks good. Lots of round coffee aroma as well as grass and hoppy bitter sensation and interesting earthy notes in the aroma. Original complex aroma. The taste is lightly sweet followed by moderate bitterness. The coffee taste is not present at first but takes over in the finish. Unfortunately it disapoints me a little. Had hoped for something awesome since I love Misty Mountain and thought coffee would make a strong brown ale even better, but it doesnt really work for me. The aroma is interesting but over all too dominated by the coffee to my taste.

355ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours dark browk, almost cola like with a small beige head. Aroma is pleasant coffee, roasted malt, milk chocolate, vanilla, caramel and a hint of nuts. Flavour is medium+ sweet and medium bitter. Medium to full bodied, slightly creamy texture, soft to average carbonation. Finish is a little dry, coffee and subtle sweetness.
Dark brown color . Nice , beige head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and hint of nuts. Notes of coffee and roasted malt dominates in taste. Moderate, roasted bitterness at the end.

Dark brown pour. The new gal insisted on pouring--into a conical glass no less! Poured much too gingerly. Thin khaki cap on top as a result. Fresh ground coffee on the nose. Soft and moderately thick. Chocolate comes through first and, ultimately, more prominently. A lot of coffee flavor as well. A subtle, welcome sweetness underlies the flavors.
Brownred, cloudy, yellow foam. Chockolate, coffee in the aroma. Sweet, vanilla cocoa, chockolate, with sweet mildly burned aftertaste.

Bottle. Very dark brown with a beige head. Sweet lightish roasted coffee aroma, some hazelnuts. Not much beer, but nice. Thin for 9%. Not all that sweet with bread, brown sugar and lots of coffee. Finish is pretty dry and moderately bitter. Doesnt offer much for its strength.

The only reason this doesnt have a rating of 5 is because I dont really like to rate any that high. I expected it to be good but it is over the top delectable! The aroma is perfect coffee and the taste...just enough hint of bitter to remind it really is coffee. Got a single but will def go back for a better supply. I truly could have this for breakfast.

been laying off the high abv stuff lately but brown is a favorite style and founders is great so picked up a single. MAD - that I didnt p/u a 4 pack. wowow! aroma - 8; subdued coffee roast and wood? sludgy brown pour. Taste - 8 out of 10; . the end of the the sip is an espresso, toffee, cream, sweet perfection. wowow. will fix the 4 pack issue and check this aged.

[ bottle ][ 1.5oz ][ @Tasting ][ $? ][ mini snifter ][ 05.01.16 ] translucent sepia, thin cream ring. Heavy coffee and light brown sugar nose. Front is sweet, light marshmallow and coffee that lingers across mid, finishing very dry, brown grain and toast with light chocolate sweet accents.
Growler. Dark black color with a thick fluffy head. Big coffee nose that goes into a big coffee and chocolate flavor. Pretty good and drinkable.

Tap at the saucer. Pours a murky brown color. Tan head. Beautiful aroma of rich black coffee greets the nose. Some dark chocolate and roast. Flavor is rich coffee but surprisingly not bitter or sharp. Sweet chocolate and light roast. This is amazing! Reminds me of the old days back at The Covey.....

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Pours a dark brown with a thick light tan head. Aroma of sweet malt, hazelnut, espresso, chocolate fudge, dark chocolate. Flavor of dark roasted malts, dark chocolate squares, booze, coffee. Rich, chocolatey, heavy, light sweetness and coffee. Delicious dessert beer.
8/4/8/4/15 (3.9/5)

(Keg at Kaisla, 20160610) The beer poured deep brown and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had coffee, caramel and roasted malts. Palate was full bodied and warming with medium carbonation. Flavours were coffee, sweetness, roasting malts, mildly ash and medium bitterness. Aftertaste had coffee and bitterness. Why drown a brown ale into insane amount of coffee. I dont get this beer.

A very dark brown with a nice, persistent head. A nutty and chocolatey nose, thick and weighty. Excellent. So smooth and thick, amazing texture. Roast malts and nuts with a heavy helping of cocoa, a robust bitter finish too. This is such good brown.

355ml bottle (Kaisla, Helsinki)
Really beany aroma, full of proteins, Im sure, runner beans in particular. Dark, tight tan head. Slightly less beany taste, but still its there. Drying palate, really harshly dry. Reminds me of some dehydrating dope moments, Im almost gagging and gasping its so dry. Oh well, its drinkable, but a bit of a beany mess.

This sure is a hefty fellow. Poured a medium brown with a beige head. Aroma was big black coffee, some caramel and dark fruit too. Flavor similar, a coffee bomb of sorts. Not my complexity delivered from the beer, but I dodnt care, this is damn good.

Pours dark brown, not black at all. Nice head - creamy, lasting. Coffee and medium roast coffee on the nose. Taste has plenty of coffee, roasted malt, and a bitterness that seamlessly blends hops and coffee together. Full mouthfeel, with effervescent creaminess. Bitter, full finish. Delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle thanks to Dan. Pours a clearish cloud tosh brown. Aromas of big sweet coffee. Taste is sweetened black coffee. Really great stuff.

Dark brown pour with a medium beige head. Strong coffee aroma. Sweet, silky coffee and caramel, lactose and a hint of hops with the substantial alcohol way in the back. Somewhat dry finish with lingering coffee and caramel. On the sweet side but the strong coffee flavor is very enjoyable.
Black with foamy beige head; aroma is chocolate coffee; flava is coffee tangy acidic and sweet; feels medium and silky; finishes dry mildly bitter

Pours a very dark brown bordering on black with a decent sized mocha-beige head that settles to a thicker ring and leaves some fine spotty lace. Nose involves a whole lot of coffee though not overly roasted, more nutty, with some caramel, toasted notes, hints of smoke, light brown sugar, some milk chocolate, and a vague tropical/citric fruitiness. Pretty sweet, quite bitter. Lighter side of medium bodied, pretty actively carbed, sticky, finishing toward dry with coffee and toasted bitterness. Really enjoyable brew, and not a surprise to me with how Founders handles coffee. The brown ale qualities are not drowned out, but rather amplified. Maybe a tad thin bodied, but I think it works as the beer doesnt become a chore to drink.
Dyp mørk brun med fingerhøyt beige skum. Lukter kaffebønner, brent malt, kandis og fyldig mørk sjokolade. Fyldig. Søtlig bitter sjokolade, kandis og espresso. Kort noe saltbitter avslutning.
Bottle from Bradleys. Mahogany with red tinges. Sweet caramel coffee aroma. Sweet malty latte flavour with some hops. Very interesting brown ale.

Bottle from mchughs. Pours cloudy brown with reddish hue, off white head. Coffee, lactose, latte, hazelnut, chocolate, earthy notes. Flavour is sweet caramel latte with earthy dry sweet nut finish. Smooth and almost velvet mouthfeel. Chocolate coffee finish. A joy.

Squat bottle from Craft. Pours hazy dark brown/ruby with a finger of tan head that froths all over the place, as such. Nose is dark malt, strong coffee. Tastes of dark malt, heavy coffee, some hops, nuttiness.

Aroma: unexpectedly delicious coffee aroma, more like a coffee drink than coffee beans; Appearance: pitch black with tan head that dissipates fairly quickly; Taste: very smooth, slightly boozy, with lots of coffee; Palate: medium-heavy body with long, coffee-sweet finish; Overall: quite lovely; would definitely buy again.

12oz bottle from Giant Eagle in Grandview: murky brown-amber pour with thin tan head. aroma is pleasant coffee, chocolate. tastes are roasted coffee, cocoa, dark chocolate, earthy, chalky bitter, nuts, little tinny, sugary caramel - but not overly sweet. bitter finish. interesting.

smells like caramel latte,marshmallow,chocolate all smooth and sweet..very dark brown/red liquid that only leys light in on the very edge foamy tan head with lots of creamy lacing..tastes like a caramel latte with extra espresso a real hop bomb with a really strong coffee flavor slight hop tingle at the end..thick and big on the palate full bodied and full flavored..overall..you really should try this my new fav brown ale probably because its more like an imperial stout

Bottle, 355ml. A dark reddish beer with a big brown head. Aroma is of roasted coffee, chocolate, dried fruits and nuts. Taste is sweet with a strong roasted character. Medium to robust bodied, creamy and with moderate carbonation. Aftertaste reminds me of black coffee

Bottle, 355ml. Deep dark reddish with a creamy tan head. Aromas of coffee, nuts, dried fruits, roasted caramel, alcohol. Medium to robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Rich and smooth. Medium sweet with medium to heavy bitterness. Intense roasted and fiery alcohol character into a stinging bitter and alcohol finish. Surprised me, truly delicious.

Aroma coffee, chocolate, caramel, 
Appearance brown, white foam, tan foam, 
Taste light sweetness, medium sweetness, 
Palate medium body, 
Overall a beer that actually tastes like coffee. Delicious. I would suggest this beer to a friend.

Well you better like coffee
 A bit of sugar in your coffee as well.in this nice Porter. Not much head though. Veryou dark amber and clear with plenty of malt

12oz bottle in a teku. Pours very dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of burnt coffee but sort of in a good way, some chocolate and sweet and caramel malts, light bitterness, and some dough. Flavor the same with a nice blend. Average to smoother texture. A pretty good beer but not the best.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co, and snifter served showing a viscous, black/brown hue, with a presentable layer of tan head foam, and web-like cling to the lacing. The nose was expressive, Porter/Stout strength roasted notes that was nearly all espresso, with maybe a touch of dark cocoa, and smooth, malt creaminess. Medium+ bodied, with fair carbonation. The taste was similar, with just a hint of sweetness, roasted & earthy bitterness, and coffee-like astringency. Confusing and irrelevant style moniker as Imperial Brown, imo. Heftier than any form of Brown Ale, and quite roasted & rich for the coffee aficionado.

Beer and Smoke, Brooklyn bottle: pours brown with a light brown head. Aroma is fresh coffee and coffee grounds. Hefty bit of roasty stuff. Malty but not particularly sweet. Bitterness from the hops and coffee. Nice slightly sweet aftertaste. Very easy to drink for anbeer of its size.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a dark brown color with ruby edges, a large beige head. A big roasty coffee nose. Very sweet vanilla, coffee, lactose, some heavy sugary malt bases. Quite nice. Loads of sugary coffee.

Great high end espresso aroma with brown ale characteristics. Roasty, creamy, slightly boozy. An easy 10. Dark brown color with light tan head. Coffee flavor is subdued. Tastes of hazelnuts and keeps all of the brown ale flavor. I really didnt like the palate, found it to be watery and weak. This is a unique Founders beer that really shows off their versatility.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2016 Very dark, reddish, opaque appearance with a tall tan head, receding slowly leaving thick lacing. You can just barely see a few CO2 bubbles rising. Roasted coffee aroma, perhaps some chocolate, but dominated by the coffee. Feel is actually moderate, but seemed thin at first... that is perhaps due to expectation based on the dark color and coffee aroma. After pausing to consider this is a brown and not a stout, the feel is appropriate to style, but, OTOH, I cant escape the notion that this is really a coffee stout and that the notion of an "imperial brown" is just what the brewer called it. Nice malty, nutty flavor transitioning to a bitter coffee finish. Very much a coffee dominated beer in total. Overall, enjoyable, but not a beer youd kick back and have 2 or 3. Besides the ABV, the taste is more for slow enjoyment. If you like coffee beers, I recommend giving this one a try.

Bottle from wine warehouse. Very pleasant aroma. Taste is nutty coffee, dirt, light fruitiness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft sample. The beer is a clear light brown with a beige head of foam. The aroma has strong coffee notes with some roast, toffee, and dark chocolate coming through. Medium body. Sweet and roasty taste. Medium carbonation. Not bad, but a bit thin in the mouthfeel.

From the 12 fl. oz. bottle. The pour is deep brown with a modest tan head. Big sweet malt aroma intermingles with an ash or charcoal like smokiness. Low hop profile. The body is medium to full. The taste has the same burnt malt notes as the aroma with a moderate sweetness and a mild bitterness to finish.

Bottle, dated 03/31/16. From Highcraft Cary. Good aroma, sweet. Coffee, duh. Classic brown scent so to speak. Clean orangey brown color good initial head, faded quickly to a ring, spotty lace. Sweet flavor. Medium body, smooth creamy mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish. Its good, drinks easy for 9%. Like the flavor best, good coffee caramel chocolate thing going on, aroma tad less interesting, kind of thin on the mouthfeel. Its good, always fun to try,

text:
12 ounce bottle .. real pleasure, lots of coffee & roast .. deep booty, mouth is a touch zippy .. good, needs dark chocolate .. pretty awesome nose .. falls a but flat in the end .. .

Pours black with a thick long-lasting light tan head. Aroma is deep deep roasted malts and molasses that overall verges on coffee (if the coffee was muted by heavy cream). Taste is all of the above - deep malty coffee smoothed by cream and finishing with some mild, but dark bitterness. Best brown Ive had in a long time.

This was poured into a snifter.
The appearance was a dark brown close to black color with a sly spider web lacing rounding about after the head dissipated nicely.
The smell takes in the roasty to sweet coffee, almost espresso sweet aromatics blending with some vanilla, caramel, nuts.
The taste was basically the same with a nice balance between the sweetness to the roastiness. Subtle dry roasty aftertaste and a sly wet finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a great sesionable feel to me. Slight stickiness in the feel, but not overbearing.
Overall, imperialized brown ale or American strong ale? well, lets just say I really liked it for me, pulling in a wonderful array of great aromas ranging perhaps closer to an English styled strong ale, still, I would love to have again for me.
This is the perfect counterpoint to the KBS. where the KBS delivers a KO, this is so much more refined. And absolutely perfectly balanced with zero negatives. Definition of velvet hammer. Love it.

Coffee on the nose with a mild, roasted nuttiness. Moderate sweetness is balanced by the spot on amount of bitterness. Nice mouth feel, not to heavy, abrupt finish. Superb on its own Im thinking a lighter alternative (not lesser) to the Founders Breakfast Stout that can hang with summer fare such as ice cream. Great with roasted salted peanuts. A must try.

Sampled at the W&C Place Beer Fest 2016. It poured a brown color with a tan head. The aroma was of coffee and roasted malts. The taste was similar to the aroma with some espresso, toasted malts and some mild sweetness. Good stuff.
Bottle. Brown pour with tan head. Roasted, and sweet Sumatra coffee aromas. Roasted, sweet coffee, straight forward coffee from start to finish.
Bottle- pours brown- nose and taste of coffee, chocolate and caramel- medium body

On tap at Global Brew. Pours a dark garnet brown with a thin but retentive light tan head. Aroma is dried dark fruit. Taste is roasted and caramel malt, mild tartness, buttered biscuits, roasted coffee, medium bitterness and a bit of alcohol. Very good!

12 oz bottle from De Bierkoning.Clear deep dark brown color with a red hue. Light beige head. Aromas: ground coffee, hard roasted, caramel, red fruit. Retronasal its ground coffee, roast, sweet. Flavor is moderate to full sweet with just a touch of coffee sourness. Medium bodied. Good carbo. Long finish, roasted, bitter.

Bottle at home (bottled 03/31/16). Pours reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma has lots of coffee, roasted malts, caramel, bit nutty, light alcohol. Taste is light to moderate bitter, moderate sweet, coffee, caramel, roasted malts, hint of chocolate, alcohol. Long coffee aftertaste, some warming alcohol. Very nice!

Bottle. Poured a medium brown with a minimal tan head. Nose was caramel, coffee and roasted malt. The flavor followed the aroma. Very minimal carbonation and it was fairly "thick". The alcohol was well hidden for 9%. A very good brown!

Bottle. Pours deep brown with tan head and lace. Aromas of coffee and roasted malt. Big espresso flavor with toasted malt and a hint of sweetness. The body is thick and creamy for a brown with average carbonation. A great Brown!

Bottle, pours amber brown with average sized top. Overly roasty malts and coffee, oak, ash, and caramel. Flavor was most of the same with bittersweet bakers chocolate and overly brewed coffee. A bit aggressive on the palate but the alcohol was well hidden at 9. Alright

Pours dark brown-black with a one finger tan head with excellent lacing. Aroma is of dark roast gourmet coffee, lightly roasted malts, bakers coco, sweet malts, brown sugar, vanilla, and caramel. Taste is pretty similar to the aroma. Has a medium-full body with a creamy mouthfeel and a mostly sweet, long finish. Overall, a outstanding brown ale that drinks like s beer much lower in abv.

Bottle. Pours clear red chestnut, medium creamy tan head, long lasting with nice lacing. Aroma is loads of espresso, light ashtray, cocoa, caramel. Flavor is much the same, loads and loads of espresso, hints of cocoa, light plus sweet, light plus bitter, some acidity, plenty of ashtray. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel You are pretty much going to need to be good with coffee to appreciate this one.
Pours a dark brown with tan head. An incredibly strong dark coffee bean (a) aroma. A strong creamy dark coffee taste with malts, caramel, and some nuts. A lingering smooth malt aftertaste.

coffee and a bit of hop way back into the foam. smooth and just a touch of syrup in the body yet still refreshing. caramel is prominent a bit of nut and a touch of cocoa (perhaps). not a big alcohol presence. well satisfying.

Bottle into a pint glass. Pours a deep clear brown, with a huge tan head. Nose is coffee and dark roast malt. Taste follows, with a touch of chocolate and hazelnut. Creamy mouth feel and a long finish. Excellent.

Bottle. Aroma of strong coffee and chocolate. flavor is decadent coffee, chocolate, and a little bit of nuttiness. Very good but I cant honestly tell a difference between this and Breakfast Stout. Damn tasty and quite drinkable for 9%.
Coffee espresso. Coffee lead, with thick cocoa powder and vanilla finish. Thin but coats the tounge. Decent. A rare brown I can tolerate

Bottle from andersons. Thick dark body and khaki head. Nose is molasses and cocoa and caramel. Smooth body with mix of sugary sweetness and ale bite. Taste follows the nose - cocoa and coffee and bit of toast and caramel hiding in there too. Really good. Hides alcohol extremely well. Would definitely do again.

355ml embossed bottle. Pours with a brilliant cascading tan head. Pour is reddish brown. Aroma is fresh coffee and cocoa. Falvor is caramel and coffee,and some herbal hops. Has a savory autolyzed yeast character to it but it is mild, pretty solid.
Dark brown pour. Small tan head. Little lacing. Big coffee aroma. Chocolate as well. Taste is chocolatey coffee.

Pours a deep caramel brown color with a khaki head. Dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, caramel and toast aroma. Cocoa, dark roast coffee, caramel, roasted malt, nut, toast and light molasses flavors. Medium full body and average carbonation. Cocoa, coffee and toast finish.
Great coffee scent and some nutty aroma too. Sweetness but still bitter enough to balance. Coffee is smooth and it does have a nice nutty brown flavor. Mouth is full and rich for a brown. Bottle

bottle @ Party Source / Bellevue KY --- Aroma of malt and burlap (good aroma). Opaque brown/black color, rocky tan head that stays awhile, lace cobwebs. Taste is rich malt with chocolate and black coffee that moves through a medium fizzed swallow to enough bittering to keep the sweet in check. Big and brash, full-bodied, complex, balanced, a solid American Strong Ale, although It seems more like a Stout to me.

Pours a deep brown with reddish hues, slight adhesion to sides of glass when typed from off white head. Fantastic roasty aroma with significant chocolate and coffee. Taste is not quite as bold but still very satisfying and follows nose with the addition of caramel.
An awesome offering, pours coffee brown with minimal lacing. Taste is iced coffee with a beer background. May be my favorite beer.

BOD 3/31/16. Dark brown porter like pour. World class head volume, lacing and retention.

Quite outstanding nose of rich fresh coffee, light chocolate, a whiff of earthy hops and a solid malt base with caramel.

Heavy light body that is smooth and hints at being slick. As it warms, body transitions to light medium with a subtle creaminess. World class carbonation / body balance with a strong mid-palate effervescence and a rousing finely bubbled prickly finish. The effervescent finish allows the flavors to separate and linger very, very well.

The flavor profile is world class. Intensity, complexity and balance all are near perfection. It begins with rich coffee then flows into a mild bitter middle that has an earthy quality. From the midpoint on, complexity is evident as a mild sweetness arrives allowing for separation. Caramel, chocolate, hints of black strap molasses and a very subtle dark fruit note arrive. The finish provides a delightful fade of lingering coffee over the slowly receding sweet base.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2017 Dark copper, sparse lace. Medium to full body, silky texture, well flavored, rich mouthfeel with good heat and carbonation, very good length, rich and tasty finish. Sweet more than bitter but adequate balance with acidity complementing it. Roast, coffee flavors, caramel, milk chocolate, alcohol, distinct but not overwhelming. Reminds me of a good porter. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the Beer Baron. It pours a nice brown color with a thick, frothy brown head. The aroma is intense with spent coffee grounds and chocolate. Rich smelling. The flavor is very thick and rich with coffee, chocolate, very mild hints of cinnamon and spice with some heavy toasted notes in the finish along with strong coffee. Really intense coffee character. Good, but very heavy on the palate.

Dark brown color with small light brown head and messy lacing. Aroma and flavor have nice light maltiness, bready like a pizza crust, and nice addition of coffee. Bold flavor and easy to drink- very good!
Big aromas of coffee and dark chocolate. Taste is strong dark roasted coffee and dark chocolate. Cream and slight caramel follow, along with some nutty flavor a. Some faint bitter hops in the finish.

Pours dark brown, the head fades from average to short fairly quickly. The aroma is really wonderful. Chocolate and caramel, walnuts, espresso, some spice. The flavor is even better. Really rich, really smooth. A great coffee character, with more of those notes from the aroma. Warm, rich, slightly sweet, just delicious. This is fantastic beer.

12 oz. bottled 04/05/2016. Brownest brown, near black with a lasting thin creamy foam. Aroma is dark roasted coffee, toasted walnut, whole grain bread, toffee and chocolate malt. Flavor is an exquisite blend of dark chocolate, espresso with malt and cream, caramel, roasted peanut and charred wood. Medium-plus body has smooth medium carbonation and a good balance given the big malt.

bottle from Brewtopia. Dark brown with ring and lace. Strong coffee and roasted caramel maple syrup aroma. Roasted caramel coffee with minimal fruit sweetness nutty toasty yeastiness and woody long coffee finish. Medium full body. Not gooey or cloying at all, which is an accomplishment in itself. Slightly oily. Very good. Would love to try it without the coffee.

On draught at Pies and Pints Short North during the "Founders Meet & Greet and KBS Blowout" on 05/13/2016. Dark brown color with a medium foamy tan head that diminishes steadily to a film. Patchy lacing on the glass. Aroma of roast malt, coffee and vanilla. Medium to full body with a roasty coffee and malt character, with some chocolate and vanilla in the background. The finish is bittersweet espresso and malt. Good beer all around.

Pours deep dark brown with an off white head. Aroma is earthy, roast, coffee bean, nuts and more coffee. Taste is mild roasty bitters with a touch of sweetness. Medium bodied, smooth, soft carbonation and overall a very nice beer.

Bottle. Poured a dark brown with a creamy tan head. Aromas burst out with amazing coffee notes along with cream, and some chocolate. Flavor followed with strong coffee and cream, light sugar sweetness, and very smooth. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, smooth finish.

12 oz bottle. Pours an extremely deep red brown with a light tan head. Roasty creamy coffee aroma with a bit of malty molasses sweetness. Flavor is smooth rich coffee with some cocoa and molasses touches. Pretty good stuff.

355ml bottle from Whole Foods Santa Monica, CA. Pours dark brown with a smooth white head. Aroma of coffee, roasty malts, mocha, espresso and hints of vanilla. Taste is smooth, slightly roasty and heavy with coffee notes, some mocha, espresso and vanilla. Finish is malty, slightly roasty and hoppy with loads of coffee and mocha notes. Quite a coffee overdose, but still very balanced and tasty.

Smooth and nutty with a slight bitter finish. Bitter from coffee and not hops. Smells like Breakfast Stout but tastes different. Very easy drinker for 9%. Another dangerous one from Founders that should be a supper but drinks too easy. Good stuff.

Bottle. Looks like a brown ale. Smells like coffee. Flavor is nutty and mild, with a well hidden alcohol content that gently burns the back of the throat as it goes down. This is surprisingly well done and it doesnt, to my surprise, become another type of beer. Its just a strong brown ale that smells like really good coffee.

Draft. Nose is moderate coffee, light fudge and chocolate, some toast and nuttiness. Faint alcohol on the nose. Pour is deep brown with a medium sized off white head. Taste follows with more deep graham cracker and dark bread malt flavors and a moderate coffee that is always smooth, very light in the roast and never burnt. Mouthfeel seems a touch thin for a 9% beer but still supports the alcohol and coffee. Mouthfeel Drinks like a 4% beer but you still get the alcohol effects of a light warming. Nice.

Its it pours deep brown with a good-sized dense tan head. The aroma has rich nuttiness, roasted coffee, toasty malt, vanilla and milk chocolate. It has a medium body with a lot of mild carbonation. The taste starts with dry toasty malt, dry bread, coffee and dark chocolate. The finish has some spice, earthy hops and dark coffee. Really nice and alcohol is well hidden.

Strong roasted coffee aroma, along with lighter nutty, bread, grain and molasses aromas. Hops contribute a generalized bitterness.

Color is a dark brown with a small off-white head.

Taste is fairly sweet, probably from the high alcohol content (9%). The bitterness is medium to high.

The body is medium; carbonation is average; the finish is long with roasted coffee and warm sweet alcohol.

Overall I like this beer a fair amount. The roasted coffee flavor is the purest and strongest of any beer I have ever tasted. The strong roasted coffee and the warm, sweet alcohol work well together - like an alcoholic espresso!
12 ounce bottle. Pours brown with a decent tan head. Aroma of coffee and caramel. Taste is coffee, caramel, malt, and a bit of chocolate. Somewhat thin body. Nice.

12oz bottle from Whole Foods Market (Charlottesville, VA). Coffee aromas, nutty, chocolatey, roasty, caramel. Clear brown with a fully lasting beige head. Pretty dry, loaded with coffee flavors, a little boozy. Medium-full bodied.

Brown colored, moderate tan head, good lace/retention. Aroma is big coffee with notes of caramel, chocolate, light cola. Medium bodied, big coffee flavors - I tasted this relatively blindly expecting a bland brown ale and got an imperial brown loaded with coffee. Pretty nicely done.

Bottle. Pours a deep brown color with light khaki head. Coffee, cocoa, maple, malty aromas. Coffee, maple syrup, cocoa, malty flavors. Full bodied, smooth, full of flavor. Awesome beer, fuck yeah! Probably the best new beer Ive tried so far in 2016

Pours a an opaque Brown with tons of sediment. Moderate Khaki head that does not hold. Aroma is fantastic. Coffee up front with notes of toffee and cocoa. Flavor is the same. Medium/Full body. Lasting bitter finish. Coffee is the story here and its told well. Fantastic Brown.

Shared (thanks Mike) 12 oz bottle at the 2016 Aiken Bluegrass Festival.

Flavor: not as strong as expected, although the lasting aftertaste is. Dark chocolate, dark roasted grains and, of course, coffee dominate.
Partially hidden alcohol.

Aroma is a chocolate coffee, strong coffee aroma but a bit oxidized with some nice berry notes. Bittersweet chocolate gets bigger. Strong cocoa taste with coffee, rich sweet , malty, strong Piney? I think towards finish. There is some hoppyness in there but is overwhelmed by the dark malts. Sweet at first but becomes more balanced. A bit sticky still, but isnt a brown maybe especially an imperial brown maybe bringing on some sweetness? I got 3 more to decide how well I like this, so far not bad, better than average. Not that there are a lot of these out there. I would say its certainly worth the price of a 4 pack, so well done, but I feel like I could like it more. Maybe a bit on the sweet side. Also, I dont think its the best coffee aroma/taste Ive had, in a beer or in a coffee.
Bottle. Deep brown with a thin white head. Rich coffee aroma, molasses, almond and a little soy sauce. Light sweetness with a dry nutty aftertaste. Body is medium with a fizzy, oily feel.

12oz bottle pours a deep brown with some spitty, brown head. Nose is nice, big with malt and caramel, a fairly aromatic coffee too - but not overpowering, caramel, a little multigrain bread too. Flavor follows, really nice blend of brown/turbinado sugar, caramel and pleasant/mild roast coffee. Dry finish. Drinks MUCH easier than 9%.
Bottle from Binny. Poured brown with off white head. Aroma nutty sweet fresh coffee roast. Light carb med bod. Taste light bitter great coffee cream.

Bottle. Pours out a decent lightly brown color with a small tan head. Aroma is of sweetened coffee, light brown sugar, caramel, toffee. Taste is much the same, caramel, toffee, toasted, some molasses, sweetened/creamy coffee. Eh, I like my coffee in your face and not altered at all and this didnt do it.

Deep brown pour with a thin off white head and light sticky lacing .... Aroma reminisent of KBS coffee wise with roasted and caramel malt notes along with a nutty hazlenut flavor but dominated by fresh coffee ..... Taste is of rich coffee, some warming booze, hazelnut, roasted and caramel malts ..... Has a lot of depth and is oily in the mouthfeel .... Has a bitter bite in the finish and a big roasted and coffee finish .... Really great sipping beer that was good cold and as it warmed up .... Makes you wish it was KBS but Ill still take it!

Pours a clean and sharp dark brown with two fingers of dark tan head. Nose shows bright coffee and a kind of pepper flesh note that I get from coffee beers on occasion. Toasted grain and rustic malt notes. Earthy/bready grain. Light chocolate in the flavor with coffee and a smooth round caramel sweetness. Warming on the finish with a medium body.

Tallahassee, Fl - ABC Fine Wine & Spirits - Betton - 12 oz bottle. Dark cola pour, khaki colored head, sticks around a while, brief lacing. Delectable, decadent aroma with strong coffee notes, some bitter unsweetened chocolate. Full bodied flavor with plenty of dark espresso notes, some creosote, heavy dose of unsweetened bakers chocolate. Melts in your mouth. Thick, slightly chalky mouthfeel, just right.

2016 bottle. 12 oz bottle pours hazy reddish brown with a tan head that has great retention. Subtle coffee aroma, lots of hazelnuts, and some roast. Very nice mouthfeel. Smooth, nutty, coffee. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Lots of coffee and some caramel and light roast. Light sweet finish. Some booze. Ok but not what I would call super balanced. Brown pour with decent head and lacing. Tap at Churchkey.

12oz bottle from Spirits Lakewood. Poured a deep Tootsie Roll brown with a foamy beige head. Aroma/flavor of "regular coffee" (black coffee with 2 sugars), dark toast and lactose. Flavor has a hint of alcohol in addition to burnt marshmallows. Bigger body with a medium mouthfeel, strong carbonation and light heat. Good stuff if you want a tasty big beer.

bottle. Deep brown with small head. Very pleasant coffee aroma. Big brown ale with substantial chocolate malt. Rich coffee undertones. Theres excellent depth of flavor here. Ive been down on some of Founders recent stuff, but this is great.

Purchased at Bottles and Cans in Chicago, IL; enjoyed at home on a very nice Thursday evening after work. I also had a little bit of this one while waiting in line at Dark Lord Day, and jumped at the chance to pick this up. Appearance is cola dark brown with a thin slightly off white head. Aroma is dominated by rich coffee notes, smells incredibly decadent, with chocolate notes as well. Taste is thick and rich, huge dark roast coffee notes, chocolate, caramel, probably one of the thicker beers Ive had, like a motor oil. Pick this up if you get the chance.

Pours dark like cola with a thin tan head. Sweet coffee aroma and a light to medium body and smooth. Hints of vanilla and chocolate

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared by Lauren. Pours clear medium brown color with tan head. Aromas of coffee and roasted malt. Big espresso flavor with toasted malt and a hint of sweetness. Medium body with average carbonation.
Dark brown color with off white head. Really good flavor. Just a little unbalanced to the bitter side.

Sampled on draft at 3R6P this beer poured a black color with orange highlights and a small foamy beige head that left minimal lacing. The aroma was toasty and roasty with brewed coffee. The flavor was bitter with cola and brewed coffee notes. Medium length finish. Medium body. Decent but I had hoped for better.

Really nice coffee aroma. Pours a dark brown/red with a nice, compact, but lasting head. It has a soft, pleasant mouthfeel. Tastes of coffee, toffee, caramel, and maybe even butterscotch. All of that sweetness is balanced nicely by the coffees bitterness. I am a bit surprised it is 9% abv, it is hidden well under all of the flavor. Excellent beer.

12 oz bottle from Party Source at home. Pours a clear, dark reddish brown color with a medium sized beige head. The aroma and flavor have big roasted coffee, some sweet cocoa, earthy, big coffee flavor with a lighter body, some roasted bitterness to the finish, pretty solid beer and nice to see this in a 12 oz bottle.

Bottle. Black pour with an egg shell head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate with big coffee and sweetness on the taste. A little too sweet for me. Drinks more like a sweet stout than a brown ale. Not bad but not great either.
Tap. Pours a dark brown with a thin layer of beige head. Aroma and taste of coffee, nuts, chocolate, and some booze.

Like so many other coffee beers, the coffee is overwhelming. There are slight hints of other flavors, caramel mostly, but the coffee crowds everything else out. Kind of a shame, it seems like it might be interesting underneath the coffee. From the brewery that makes Founders Breakfast Stout and KBS, I expected better.

12 oz. bottle. Date bottled on 3/31/2016. Deep brown color with fast dying head. Aroma is a blast of Sumatran coffee beans and some roasted nuts. 
Flavor has the coffee but leans more on walnuts and hazelnuts. A bit more caramel then I prefer. Body is medium with a creamy texture. Some lingering coffee after the sip. A light touch of alcohol after the sip. This is good but by no means mind shattering. Its still just a brown ale with coffee.
4 pack from shelf. Cool. Pours brown. Smells like coffe. Taste is like iced coffe with a touch of sweet&low. Decent. Cool brown ale, bro.
Draft at Pony Bar HK with Linh. Pours a deep amber brown body with thin lace. Nutty, toasty nose. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with notes of rich coffee, vanilla, nuts, soft roast and rich nutella.
Top quality brew! Coffee dominates aroma and taste...and I personally dont love coffee brews. Brown ale rather than stout makes it unique.

Bottle from Berts
Big coffee aroma with a malty sugary sweetness to back it up. Hints of caramel and chocolate with a touch of alcohol round this out nicely.

So ratebeer has this catagorized as an American Strong Ale even though it says on the bottle that its an Imperial Brown Ale. Funny. Any who, this pours near black with a light brown head that quickly goes away. Aroma is of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, and a little booze. Heavy palate with a little carbonation. Flavors are the same as the aroma. Leaves a nice roasted coffee finish. This is similar to their Breakfast Stout, just not as heavy. I wonder if this was a bad batch that they decided to market as a brown ale. Either way its still another good brew from Founders.

While I like coffee from about any area, Sumatran coffee is just pretty damn special. I love the bold flavor and roasted aroma. Founders Sumatra Mountain captures those elements about as well I ever couldve hoped. Hell, this is a better representation of Sumatra than some coffee-infused Stouts Ive had. Big earthy coffee aroma. Bittersweet dark chocolate and charred grain flavors. Texture balances the competing forces in this brew: lively, bright, and bitter roast with the boozy, warm 9.2% alcohol. Its no secret that Founders knows how to brew with coffee, but that doesnt make it any less exciting to see theyve still got it.

Pours very dark brown, creamy khaki head. Nose is mild for the abv, some toffee, and coffee roasty notes. Full flavor comes with a sip: coffee, chocolate, caramel, well balanced, not too sweet and the booze is very well hidden (I would have guess more like 7.5 abv). Very nicely done, though its no breakfast stout.
Im not a brown ale fan, but this one is one of the more unique ones Ive tried. The coffee aspect makes it seem a lot less bready than others, so I enjoy that.
Pours brown with lots of head lots lacing. Flavours brown bread raisins. Alcohol well hidden. Coffee. Taste med bitter med sweet.

Bootle on the couch.
Pours a dark brown with a small but well retained head & good lacing on the glass.

The aroma is lots of coffee & nutty roastiness, its lightly chocolaty and reasonably sweet smelling.

The flavor is quite rich with a lot of coffee and roasty malt. Its sweet & nutty with a nice underlying bitterness throughout. Its chocolaty and a touch on the boozy side. Almost woody at times but really quite delicious.

Bottle pour at the May 1st DC Tasting. Poured a really dark brown color with a small off-white/tan head. Aroma was roasted malts, toasted offee, roast. Chocolate, boozy brown, too much alcohol to really make this one totally enjoyable based on the body.

Rich coffee aromas with milk chocolate and cocoa, really nice.. Brown body with ruby highlights, thicker than you would think, but I like it. Coffee and roasted char notes, the chocolate is hard to detect, faint hint of booze, long coffee finish. Easy to see why this is rated so high.

Dark, finger of light khaki to off white head. Smells of earthy chocolate, fresh coffee, fudge brownie. Taste is a chocolate ice cream like sweetness, an earthy, rye like hop, sweet earthy chocolate coffee, a little toffee. A good semi sweet chocolate character throughout with freshly ground Sumatra coffee intertwined. Alcohol very well hidden, medium carbonation, slightly viscous but fairly thin. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle:
Very dark brown with a small tan head.
Sweetly nutty, caramel, coffee malt scent.
Taste is sweet...cola, roasty coffee, chocolate malt.
Nice, rich, coffee flavour.
The coffee increases in bitterness as it warms.......hardly any noticeable alcohol despite the higher octane......
An absolute delight.
Aroma of coffee, taste is coffee, nicely balanced alcohol, fudge, nice aftertaste. Aroma is absolutely amazing!
Bottle shared by Eddie - thanks! Huge coffee aroma - awesome. Brown pour. Fudge. Hazelnut. Yummy.
On tap at Final Gravity. Pours dark brown with a nic beige head and a coffee aroma. There is a rich chocolate and dark molass s flavor with coffee that stays on the palate. Very tasty.
Dark brown color with a thin head. Dry, chocolate, coffee aroma. Flavor of fudge, dark roast coffee. Very nutty, leaning hazelnut. Light brown sugar.

Pours a dark brown with a thin off-white head. Aroma is lots of coffee, roast, vanilla, toffee, and some cocoa. Flavor is coffee, roast, chocolate, and sweet toffee and caramel notes. Has a smooth body. Excellent.

On tap at Millstone in Rock Hill
Aroma is slight coffee. 
Appearance is dark brown-almost porter colored. Slight head with lacing. 
Tasting coffee, cocoa, caramel, piney hops, licorice, cola. 
Palate is exceptionally full and smooth. 
Overall, great stuff.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text:
From a bottle share at the DC gathering May 1, 2016. It is a clear dark Amber color with a slight head the aroma is coffee
And the taste is bitter roasted coffee

Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate-heavy chocolate, lighter caramel, roasted nuts, and coffee. It pours a dark brown with some red transparency when held to the light. It has a large khaki head that has very good retention before finally settling to a thick film. There is some soapy webbing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with moderate-heavy chocolate and lighter caramel. The finish has moderate coffee, cream, and roasted nuts. Its medium bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel. Overall, this is incredibly tasty and way too easy to drink for 9.2%. I really hope there are plans to continue to bottle this every year.

12oz bottle. Medium beige head atop crystal clear dark brown body. Aroma is moderately sweet, coffee, caramel, light molasses. Taste is moderately sweet, coffee, some chococaramel. Medium body, light stickiness.
From a bottle at the DC gathering May 1, 2016. Pours a clear cola brown with an off white head. Aroma of coffee. Flavors of coffee. Decent.

Deep brown in color with a thin khaki colored head. Roasted coffee is the main player here with caramel, vanilla, and burnt toast aromas in the background. Very rich flavor profile. Palate is as smooth as can be. Unless you are not a fan of coffee, I would have trouble understanding how one would not like this beer. Excellent offering!

Darker than most Browns in the glass, Cleveland or otherwise. More like a Porter or stout.
Nose is deep sweet malts and quality roasted coffee. Anytime the flavor tries to get to sweet the roast in the coffee and slight hop bitterness keeps it in check. Reminded me a lot of a couple of the Terrapin coffee stouts, just with a bigger body and maaaaaybe a touch sweeter. Awesome beer.
Nice Strong Brown. Deep mahagony color. Coffee definitely popped in taste and aroma. New mild coffee. Definitely had some chocolate and even toffee notes. Very smooth at 9% Good stuff.

12 oz bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Bottled on 3/31/2016. Dark brown with a finger of tan head. Aromas of roasted coffee, dark chocolate fudge, caramel, malt, cream. Tastes of coffee, dark chocolate, a little caramel, some malt. Medium body with a dry finish. Well masked alcohol for the ABV.
Bottle poured dark cherry cola brown with a thin beige head and little lacing. Aromas of dark fruit, coffee, vanilla, raisens, and chocolate. Flavor is semi sweet. Tasty!

12 oz. bottle from Liquor Barn (Jefferson Commons); shared with my Boo. Aroma: Big coffee roast with a lesser, but present amount of chocolate, caramel and spiced toast. Appearance: Somewhat hazy dark copper brown pour with a foamy tan head that settles into a creamy ring. Flavor: Coffee all the way up front with bolder roast and subtle fruity esters; malts come out more midway on, and maintain some caramel/spiced toast; the finish is semi-dry with a light to moderate bitterness and some definite alcohol burn. Palate: Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation, bitter finish. Overall: Pretty good stuff, but from a brewery already stacked with great coffee-centric offerings, this falls slightly short.
Draft at Mahoney's. Pours a dark brown with some off white head. Nose and taste is coffee,caramel. Tastes like a coffee with cream.

Pours translucent chocolate brown with a thick and rather persistent buff head. Aroma delivers a strong note of quality roast coffee riding toasted malt and a hint of hay. Flavor delivers bold coffee, caramel, chocolate, roast malt and woody hop notes - woo hoo, this is a delight! It is fairly sweet but not cloying. Mouthfeel features firm body and good fizz. Climb this mountain and grab a cup of Sumatran - and save the tigers.

Bottle. Pours brown with a one inch khaki head. Big coffee aroma, nutty, some chocolate. A moderate sweetness followed by a medium bitterness that lasts, some alcohol after it has warmed. Medium bodied, a touch creamy, soft side of average carbonation. Bitter, drying finish.

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 4/5/2016. Pours fairly hazy/cloudy very dark brown color with a 1-2 finger dense khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big nutty roasted coffee, milk chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, toasted brown bread, light smoke/dark fruit, herbal, wood, and roast/toasted earthiness. Fantastic aromas with awesome complexity and balance of coffee, dark/roast/bready malt, and light earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big nutty roasted coffee, milk chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, toasted brown bread, light smoke/dark fruit, herbal, wood, and roast/toasted earthiness. Light herbal/woody hop and roasted coffee bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of nutty coffee, milk chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, toasted brown bread, herbal, wood, and roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of coffee, dark/roast/bready malt, and light earthy hop flavors; with a great roast/hop bitter/sweet balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light dryness from hop/roast bitterness, that increases through the glass. Light-medium carbonation and full-ish bodied; with a very smooth, creamy, and fairly sticky/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is an insane imperial brown ale! All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of coffee, dark/roast/bready malt, and light earthy hop flavors; and very smooth and easy to drink for the big ABV. A really amazing offering all around, the coffee presence and complexity is enormous.
Shared 12oz bottle to snifters. Fresh cuppa joe. Lots of roastiness and nuttiness. Quite sweet and very smooth for the abv. Fantastic brew for coffee lovers.
12 oz bottle pours hazy reddish brown with a tan head that has great retention. Subtle coffee aroma, lots of hazelnuts, and some roast. Very nice mouthfeel. Smooth, nutty, coffee. Solid.

Bottle. Aroma is great. Fresh brewed coffee and a light honey cereal sweetness. Tastes like bitter, earthy coffee, burnt nuts, light cocoa and charred wood. Really like everything except the acidic finish which makes drinking a whole bottle harder than it should be. Still very good overall.

Pours a deep brown on tap with thin wispy tan brown head that leaves moderate lace. Aroma of nice roasty coffee notes, Sumatra gives me mocha and berries, with a hint of nutty brown underneath. Taste is more toward the bitter coffee, dry and roasty. Soft carbonation, medium body, bittersweet finish, solid.
Draft at Churchkey. Clear dark brown color, see pic please. Aroma of earthy coffee grounds. Taste is huge earth, coffee grounds and unsweetened cocoa. Tasty. Retains its beery characteristics.

Bottle from Sherm1016....thx! Pours dark dark brown..almost black. Nose is really aromatic coffee...as is the initial taste. Strong coffee taste and body hide the 9% ABV...be careful. This is a really large brown; very tasty!!
12 ounce bottle. Dark chocolate coffee goodness. Medium body. Very tasty. Very drinkable.

Deep brown. Heavy roast coffee with a touch of cream, fruit, and toasted malt. Flavor is robust roast coffee with moderate acidity. Dont get much else other than a bit of toasted malt and mild fruit. Lingering acidic coffee. My guess is this will be a knockout in a couple months when the coffee has quieted down just a bit.

Bottle from Discount in Waukesha brought by bananabi11. Thanks E! Brown pour with a tan head. Big roasty coffee aroma. Taste is super smooth coffee. Not a ton of depth. Bittersweet and roasty. Very tasty. For what this is - it is excellent. 15.3

Aromas of light coffee roast, maple, brown sugar, toffee and dark grain malt. Pours a blackish brown with a lively tan head and big lacing. Taste brings chocolate, coffee beans, oak, brown sugar, toffee, cold brewed coffee, roasted malt, nougat, almonds and sweet malt notes. Finishes with residual chocolate and coffee on the palate. Overall, this is an excellent brown ale with a bold and robust body.
Pours a thick brown color with a creamy off white colored head. Notes of roasted nuts, chocolate syrup, smoke, and green coffee. Nice
I like coffee and I like beer and I like this.... I think that about sums up my feelings regarding this beer.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

On draft at Founders. The pour is a nice cola brown color with hints of ruby and orange poking through with a larger white foamy head and no lace as it falls to a bubbly collar. The aroma is magnificent. There is so much coffee it's incredible. That's all you need in a brown. Rather than roasted malt, it's roasted coffee. Incredible. The flavor is much of the same. Heavy coffee that does fade to a light caramel. There is a decent sweet brown character to the flavor and it's a little different. The mouth feel is a touch light and the aftertaste is heavy in the roasted coffee. It's a solid brew. If this was a little thicker, it would incredible! Very good brew though. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Founders - pours medium brown with thin off white head . Hefty coffee aroma . Coffee is primary flavor with a little toffee and nuttiness . Very good ! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at brewery in pint glass. Dark brown slight reddish hues, medium light brown head. Lots of fresh brewed coffee on the nose, some molasses. Medium to full body, sticky, slightly bitter. Long dark chocolate finish. Nice beer.

Aroma is fresh roasted coffee, nutty, sweet malt. Appearance is brown, light brown head. Taste is wonderful, fresh coffee and sweet malt, real good. Mouthfeel is medium body and carbonation. Overall, my god this is good.

Tap from Founders taproom. Pours slightly brown, amber, tan head. Aroma is big coffee, roasted malts. Those pop the most. Flavor is similar, roasted malts, clearly a brown ale with its malt profile, and the coffee is added. Solid, but exactly what you expect it to be.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear brown with a very light brown head that dissipates slowly to the edges and laces. Aroma is full of coffee with notes of sweet dark grains and a hint of bread supporting. Flavor is also full of coffee with dark grains and a touch of bread.

Founders Sumatra brown. Growler thanks to the neiweems once again.  
Super!... Pours a darker caramel toffee hue with a thin to medium  
frothy head... Aroma is akin to a breakfast stout coffee influence  
which cannot be complained about in the slightest. Coffee forward with  
a good degree of roast... Flavors are coffee forward to an assertive  
extent, roasty while meshing well with a caramel malt and a semi-spicy  
rye breadiness. Sweeter sugary tones through the middle while pushing  
through towards the finish. A very light bitterness comes into play  
very late in the finish. Carbonation is semi-lively and jiving well  
with its body. Could have been a touch less sweet but its a minor  
quibble. A little one dimensional really but pretty good stuff overall especially from someone who enjoys their coffee infused brews.
8/4/7/4/16

fizzy brown body with small off-white head.  aroma of roasted malt, fresh coffee beans, and nuts with mild residual sugar. flavor is heavily roasted and is one of the best browns i have ever had. sweet with fresh coffee. superbEarlier Rating: 12/23/2010 Total Score: 4absolutely delicious. a great coffee based beer from founders..surprised?! i hope not. aft. hazy brown body with small beige head..nicely carbonated. massive nose of nuts, fresh brewed coffee, brown sugar and syrup.. delicious, sweetened coffee, with roasted nuts, sugary breads, and slight earthiness. grassy, yet roasted. sweet and dry.

On tap at the Founders Tap Room on 12/23/2010.
This is a phenomenal beer, and truly original.  Take the smooth, oily roasted coffee flavors from their Breakfast Stout, and mix them in with the malty sweetness of a Dirty Bastard (minus the 60+ IBUs), and you have the Sumatra Mt. Brown.  Low hop bitterness, thick mouthfeel, TONS of pleasant coffee notes and a delicate sweet finish.  I predict that this would be their next big hit if they started bottling it.  A must try.

growler courtesy of sprinkle, thanks for this gem! excellent looking pour, hazy with a dense, cascading head. the aroma and flavor are tons of coffe, tastes like a cold extraction. very nice brew, one of the best coffee focused beers ive had, and probably the best brown ale ive had period.

Draft. Poured hazy brown color with an average fizzy light brown head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy roasted coffee, nuts with a small alcohol aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy roasteed coffee and sweet flavor with a medium to heavy roasted sweet finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout beer.
